180const uint8_t* DefaultEmbeddedBlobCode() {
181 return v8_Default_embedded_blob_code_;
182}
183uint32_t DefaultEmbeddedBlobCodeSize() {
184 return v8_Default_embedded_blob_code_size_;
185}
186const uint8_t* DefaultEmbeddedBlobData() {
187 return v8_Default_embedded_blob_data_;
188}
189uint32_t DefaultEmbeddedBlobDataSize() {
190 return v8_Default_embedded_blob_data_size_;

193namespace {
194// These variables provide access to the current embedded blob without requiring
195// an isolate instance. This is needed e.g. by
196// InstructionStream::InstructionStart, which may not have access to an isolate
197// but still needs to access the embedded blob. The variables are initialized by
198// each isolate in Init(). Writes and reads are relaxed since we can guarantee
199// that the current thread has initialized these variables before accessing
200// them. Different threads may race, but this is fine since they all attempt to
201// set the same values of the blob pointer and size.
202
203std::atomic<const uint8_t*> current_embedded_blob_code_(nullptr);
204std::atomic<uint32_t> current_embedded_blob_code_size_(0);
205std::atomic<const uint8_t*> current_embedded_blob_data_(nullptr);
206std::atomic<uint32_t> current_embedded_blob_data_size_(0);
207
208// The various workflows around embedded snapshots are fairly complex. We need
209// to support plain old snapshot builds, nosnap builds, and the requirements of
210// subtly different serialization tests. There's two related knobs to twiddle:
211//
212// - The default embedded blob may be overridden by setting the sticky embedded
213// blob. This is set automatically whenever we create a new embedded blob.
214//
215// - Lifecycle management can be either manual or set to refcounting.
216//
217// A few situations to demonstrate their use:
218//
219// - A plain old snapshot build neither overrides the default blob nor
220// refcounts.
221//
222// - mksnapshot sets the sticky blob and manually frees the embedded
223// blob once done.
224//
225// - Most serializer tests do the same.
226//
227// - Nosnapshot builds set the sticky blob and enable refcounting.
228
229// This mutex protects access to the following variables:
230// - sticky_embedded_blob_code_
231// - sticky_embedded_blob_code_size_
232// - sticky_embedded_blob_data_
233// - sticky_embedded_blob_data_size_
234// - enable_embedded_blob_refcounting_
235// - current_embedded_blob_refs_
236base::LazyMutex current_embedded_blob_refcount_mutex_ = LAZY_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
237
238const uint8_t* sticky_embedded_blob_code_ = nullptr;
239uint32_t sticky_embedded_blob_code_size_ = 0;
240const uint8_t* sticky_embedded_blob_data_ = nullptr;
241uint32_t sticky_embedded_blob_data_size_ = 0;
242
243bool enable_embedded_blob_refcounting_ = true;
244int current_embedded_blob_refs_ = 0;
245
246const uint8_t* StickyEmbeddedBlobCode() { return sticky_embedded_blob_code_; }
247uint32_t StickyEmbeddedBlobCodeSize() {
248 return sticky_embedded_blob_code_size_;
249}
250const uint8_t* StickyEmbeddedBlobData() { return sticky_embedded_blob_data_; }
251uint32_t StickyEmbeddedBlobDataSize() {
252 return sticky_embedded_blob_data_size_;
253}
254
255void SetStickyEmbeddedBlob(const uint8_t* code, uint32_t code_size,
256 const uint8_t* data, uint32_t data_size) {
257 sticky_embedded_blob_code_ = code;
258 sticky_embedded_blob_code_size_ = code_size;
259 sticky_embedded_blob_data_ = data;
260 sticky_embedded_blob_data_size_ = data_size;
261}
262
263} // namespace
264
265void DisableEmbeddedBlobRefcounting() {
266 base::MutexGuard guard(current_embedded_blob_refcount_mutex_.Pointer());
267 enable_embedded_blob_refcounting_ = false;
268}
269
270void FreeCurrentEmbeddedBlob() {
271 CHECK(!enable_embedded_blob_refcounting_);
272 base::MutexGuard guard(current_embedded_blob_refcount_mutex_.Pointer());
273
274 if (StickyEmbeddedBlobCode() == nullptr) return;
275
276 CHECK_EQ(StickyEmbeddedBlobCode(), Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobCode());
277 CHECK_EQ(StickyEmbeddedBlobData(), Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobData());
278
279 OffHeapInstructionStream::FreeOffHeapOffHeapInstructionStream(
280 const_cast<uint8_t*>(Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobCode()),
281 Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobCodeSize(),
282 const_cast<uint8_t*>(Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobData()),
283 Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobDataSize());
284
285 current_embedded_blob_code_.store(nullptr, std::memory_order_relaxed);
286 current_embedded_blob_code_size_.store(0, std::memory_order_relaxed);
287 current_embedded_blob_data_.store(nullptr, std::memory_order_relaxed);
288 current_embedded_blob_data_size_.store(0, std::memory_order_relaxed);
289 sticky_embedded_blob_code_ = nullptr;
290 sticky_embedded_blob_code_size_ = 0;
291 sticky_embedded_blob_data_ = nullptr;
292 sticky_embedded_blob_data_size_ = 0;
293}
294
295// static
296bool Isolate::CurrentEmbeddedBlobIsBinaryEmbedded() {
297 // In some situations, we must be able to rely on the embedded blob being
298 // immortal immovable. This is the case if the blob is binary-embedded.
299 // See blob lifecycle controls above for descriptions of when the current
300 // embedded blob may change (e.g. in tests or mksnapshot). If the blob is
301 // binary-embedded, it is immortal immovable.
302 const uint8_t* code =
303 current_embedded_blob_code_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
304 if (code == nullptr) return false;
305 return code == DefaultEmbeddedBlobCode();
306}
307
308void Isolate::SetEmbeddedBlob(const uint8_t* code, uint32_t code_size,
309 const uint8_t* data, uint32_t data_size) {
310 CHECK_NOT_NULL(code);
311 CHECK_NOT_NULL(data);
312
313 embedded_blob_code_ = code;
314 embedded_blob_code_size_ = code_size;
315 embedded_blob_data_ = data;
316 embedded_blob_data_size_ = data_size;
317 current_embedded_blob_code_.store(code, std::memory_order_relaxed);
318 current_embedded_blob_code_size_.store(code_size, std::memory_order_relaxed);
319 current_embedded_blob_data_.store(data, std::memory_order_relaxed);
320 current_embedded_blob_data_size_.store(data_size, std::memory_order_relaxed);
321
322#ifdef DEBUG
323 // Verify that the contents of the embedded blob are unchanged from
324 // serialization-time, just to ensure the compiler isn't messing with us.
325 EmbeddedData d = EmbeddedData::FromBlob();
326 if (d.EmbeddedBlobDataHash() != d.CreateEmbeddedBlobDataHash()) {
327 FATAL(
328 "Embedded blob data section checksum verification failed. This "
329 "indicates that the embedded blob has been modified since compilation "
330 "time.");
331 }
332 if (v8_flags.text_is_readable) {
333 if (d.EmbeddedBlobCodeHash() != d.CreateEmbeddedBlobCodeHash()) {
334 FATAL(
335 "Embedded blob code section checksum verification failed. This "
336 "indicates that the embedded blob has been modified since "
337 "compilation time. A common cause is a debugging breakpoint set "
338 "within builtin code.");
339 }
340 }
341#endif // DEBUG
342}
343
344void Isolate::ClearEmbeddedBlob() {
345 CHECK(enable_embedded_blob_refcounting_);
346 CHECK_EQ(embedded_blob_code_, CurrentEmbeddedBlobCode());
347 CHECK_EQ(embedded_blob_code_, StickyEmbeddedBlobCode());
348 CHECK_EQ(embedded_blob_data_, CurrentEmbeddedBlobData());
349 CHECK_EQ(embedded_blob_data_, StickyEmbeddedBlobData());
350
351 embedded_blob_code_ = nullptr;
352 embedded_blob_code_size_ = 0;
353 embedded_blob_data_ = nullptr;
354 embedded_blob_data_size_ = 0;
355 current_embedded_blob_code_.store(nullptr, std::memory_order_relaxed);
356 current_embedded_blob_code_size_.store(0, std::memory_order_relaxed);
357 current_embedded_blob_data_.store(nullptr, std::memory_order_relaxed);
358 current_embedded_blob_data_size_.store(0, std::memory_order_relaxed);
359 sticky_embedded_blob_code_ = nullptr;
360 sticky_embedded_blob_code_size_ = 0;
361 sticky_embedded_blob_data_ = nullptr;
362 sticky_embedded_blob_data_size_ = 0;
363}

398// static
399base::AddressRegion Isolate::GetShortBuiltinsCallRegion() {
400 // Update calculations below if the assert fails.
401 static_assert(kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB <= 4096);
402 if (kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB == 0) {
403 // Return empty region if pc-relative calls/jumps are not supported.
404 return base::AddressRegion(kNullAddress, 0);
405 }
406 constexpr size_t max_size = std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max();
407 if (uint64_t{kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB} * MB > max_size) {
408 // The whole addressable space is reachable with pc-relative calls/jumps.
409 return base::AddressRegion(kNullAddress, max_size);
410 }
411 constexpr size_t radius = kMaxPCRelativeCodeRangeInMB * MB;
412
413 DCHECK_LT(CurrentEmbeddedBlobCodeSize(), radius);
414 Address embedded_blob_code_start =
415 reinterpret_cast<Address>(CurrentEmbeddedBlobCode());
416 if (embedded_blob_code_start == kNullAddress) {
417 // Return empty region if there's no embedded blob.
418 return base::AddressRegion(kNullAddress, 0);
419 }
420 Address embedded_blob_code_end =
421 embedded_blob_code_start + CurrentEmbeddedBlobCodeSize();
422 Address region_start =
423 (embedded_blob_code_end > radius) ? (embedded_blob_code_end - radius) : 0;
424 Address region_end = embedded_blob_code_start + radius;
425 if (region_end < embedded_blob_code_start) {
426 region_end = static_cast<Address>(-1);
427 }
428 return base::AddressRegion(region_start, region_end - region_start);
429}
430
431size_t Isolate::HashIsolateForEmbeddedBlob() {
432 DCHECK(builtins_.is_initialized());
433 DCHECK(Builtins::AllBuiltinsAreIsolateIndependent());
434
435 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
436
437 static constexpr size_t kSeed = 0;
438 size_t hash = kSeed;
439
440 // Hash static entries of the roots table.
441 hash = base::hash_combine(hash, V8_STATIC_ROOTS_BOOL);
442#if V8_STATIC_ROOTS_BOOL
443 hash = base::hash_combine(hash,
444 static_cast<int>(RootIndex::kReadOnlyRootsCount));
445 RootIndex i = RootIndex::kFirstReadOnlyRoot;
446 for (auto ptr : StaticReadOnlyRootsPointerTable) {
447 hash = base::hash_combine(ptr, hash);
448 ++i;
449 }
450#endif // V8_STATIC_ROOTS_BOOL
451
452 // Hash data sections of builtin code objects.
453 for (Builtin builtin = Builtins::kFirst; builtin <= Builtins::kLast;
454 ++builtin) {
455 Tagged<Code> code = builtins()->code(builtin);
456
457 DCHECK(Internals::HasHeapObjectTag(code.ptr()));
458 uint8_t* const code_ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(code.address());
459
460 // These static asserts ensure we don't miss relevant fields. We don't hash
461 // instruction_start, but other data fields must remain the same.
462 static_assert(Code::kEndOfStrongFieldsOffset ==
463 Code::kInstructionStartOffset);
464#ifndef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
465 static_assert(Code::kInstructionStartOffsetEnd + 1 == Code::kFlagsOffset);
466#endif
467 static_assert(Code::kFlagsOffsetEnd + 1 == Code::kInstructionSizeOffset);
468 static_assert(Code::kInstructionSizeOffsetEnd + 1 ==
469 Code::kMetadataSizeOffset);
470 static_assert(Code::kMetadataSizeOffsetEnd + 1 ==
471 Code::kInlinedBytecodeSizeOffset);
472 static_assert(Code::kInlinedBytecodeSizeOffsetEnd + 1 ==
473 Code::kOsrOffsetOffset);
474 static_assert(Code::kOsrOffsetOffsetEnd + 1 ==
475 Code::kHandlerTableOffsetOffset);
476 static_assert(Code::kHandlerTableOffsetOffsetEnd + 1 ==
477 Code::kUnwindingInfoOffsetOffset);
478 static_assert(Code::kUnwindingInfoOffsetOffsetEnd + 1 ==
479 Code::kConstantPoolOffsetOffset);
480 static_assert(Code::kConstantPoolOffsetOffsetEnd + 1 ==
481 Code::kCodeCommentsOffsetOffset);
482 static_assert(Code::kCodeCommentsOffsetOffsetEnd + 1 ==
483 Code::kParameterCountOffset);
484 static_assert(Code::kParameterCountOffsetEnd + 1 == Code::kBuiltinIdOffset);
485 static_assert(Code::kBuiltinIdOffsetEnd + 1 == Code::kUnalignedSize);
486 static constexpr int kStartOffset = Code::kFlagsOffset;
487
488 for (int j = kStartOffset; j < Code::kUnalignedSize; j++) {
489 hash = base::hash_combine(hash, size_t{code_ptr[j]});
490 }
491 }
492
493 // The builtins constants table is also tightly tied to embedded builtins.
494 hash = base::hash_combine(
495 hash, static_cast<size_t>(heap_.builtins_constants_table()->length()));
496
497 return hash;
498}

508std::atomic<int> isolate_counter{0};

510
511Isolate::PerIsolateThreadData*
512Isolate::FindOrAllocatePerThreadDataForThisThread() {
513 ThreadId thread_id = ThreadId::Current();
514 PerIsolateThreadData* per_thread = nullptr;
515 {
516 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&thread_data_table_mutex_);
517 per_thread = thread_data_table_.Lookup(thread_id);
518 if (per_thread == nullptr) {
519 if (v8_flags.adjust_os_scheduling_parameters) {
520 base::OS::AdjustSchedulingParams();
521 }
522 per_thread = new PerIsolateThreadData(this, thread_id);
523 thread_data_table_.Insert(per_thread);
524 }
525 DCHECK(thread_data_table_.Lookup(thread_id) == per_thread);
526 }
527 return per_thread;
528}
529
530void Isolate::DiscardPerThreadDataForThisThread() {
531 ThreadId thread_id = ThreadId::TryGetCurrent();
532 if (thread_id.IsValid()) {
533 DCHECK_NE(thread_manager_->mutex_owner_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed),
534 thread_id);
535 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&thread_data_table_mutex_);
536 PerIsolateThreadData* per_thread = thread_data_table_.Lookup(thread_id);
537 if (per_thread) {
538 DCHECK(!per_thread->thread_state_);
539 thread_data_table_.Remove(per_thread);
540 }
541 }
542}
543
544Isolate::PerIsolateThreadData* Isolate::FindPerThreadDataForThisThread() {
545 ThreadId thread_id = ThreadId::Current();
546 return FindPerThreadDataForThread(thread_id);
547}
548
549Isolate::PerIsolateThreadData* Isolate::FindPerThreadDataForThread(
550 ThreadId thread_id) {
551 PerIsolateThreadData* per_thread = nullptr;
552 {
553 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&thread_data_table_mutex_);
554 per_thread = thread_data_table_.Lookup(thread_id);
555 }
556 return per_thread;
557}

564
565char* Isolate::Iterate(RootVisitor* v, char* thread_storage) {
566 ThreadLocalTop* thread = reinterpret_cast<ThreadLocalTop*>(thread_storage);
567 Iterate(v, thread);
568 // Normally, ThreadLocalTop::topmost_script_having_context_ is visited weakly
569 // but in order to simplify handling of frozen threads we just clear it.
570 // Otherwise, we'd need to traverse the thread_storage again just to find this
571 // one field.
572 thread->topmost_script_having_context_ = Context();
573 return thread_storage + sizeof(ThreadLocalTop);
574}
575
576void Isolate::IterateThread(ThreadVisitor* v, char* t) {
577 ThreadLocalTop* thread = reinterpret_cast<ThreadLocalTop*>(t);
578 v->VisitThread(this, thread);
579}
580
581void Isolate::Iterate(RootVisitor* v, ThreadLocalTop* thread) {
582 // Visit the roots from the top for a given thread.
583 v->VisitRootPointer(Root::kStackRoots, nullptr,
584 FullObjectSlot(&thread->exception_));
585 v->VisitRootPointer(Root::kStackRoots, nullptr,
586 FullObjectSlot(&thread->pending_message_));
587 v->VisitRootPointer(Root::kStackRoots, nullptr,
588 FullObjectSlot(&thread->context_));
589
590 for (v8::TryCatch* block = thread->try_catch_handler_; block != nullptr;
591 block = block->next_) {
592 // TODO(3770): Make TryCatch::exception_ an Address (and message_obj_ too).
593 v->VisitRootPointer(
594 Root::kStackRoots, nullptr,
595 FullObjectSlot(reinterpret_cast<Address>(&(block->exception_))));
596 v->VisitRootPointer(
597 Root::kStackRoots, nullptr,
598 FullObjectSlot(reinterpret_cast<Address>(&(block->message_obj_))));
599 }
600
601 v->VisitRootPointer(
602 Root::kStackRoots, nullptr,
603 FullObjectSlot(continuation_preserved_embedder_data_address()));
604
605 // Iterate over pointers on native execution stack.
606#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
607 wasm::WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
608
609 wasm::StackMemory* current = wasm_stacks_;
610 if (current != nullptr) {
611 do {
612 if (current->IsActive()) {
613 // The active stack's jump buffer does not match the current state, use
614 // the thread info below instead.
615 current = current->next();
616 continue;
617 }
618 for (StackFrameIterator it(this, current); !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
619 it.frame()->Iterate(v);
620 }
621 current = current->next();
622 } while (current != wasm_stacks_);
623 }
624#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
625 for (StackFrameIterator it(this, thread); !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
626 it.frame()->Iterate(v);
627 }
628}
629
630void Isolate::Iterate(RootVisitor* v) {
631 ThreadLocalTop* current_t = thread_local_top();
632 Iterate(v, current_t);
633}
634
635void Isolate::RegisterTryCatchHandler(v8::TryCatch* that) {
636 thread_local_top()->try_catch_handler_ = that;
637}
638
639void Isolate::UnregisterTryCatchHandler(v8::TryCatch* that) {
640 DCHECK_EQ(thread_local_top()->try_catch_handler_, that);
641 thread_local_top()->try_catch_handler_ = that->next_;
642 SimulatorStack::UnregisterJSStackComparableAddress(this);
643}
644
645Handle<String> Isolate::StackTraceString() {
646 if (stack_trace_nesting_level_ == 0) {
647 stack_trace_nesting_level_++;
648 HeapStringAllocator allocator;
649 StringStream::ClearMentionedObjectCache(this);
650 StringStream accumulator(&allocator);
651 incomplete_message_ = &accumulator;
652 PrintStack(&accumulator);
653 Handle<String> stack_trace = accumulator.ToString(this);
654 incomplete_message_ = nullptr;
655 stack_trace_nesting_level_ = 0;
656 return stack_trace;
657 } else if (stack_trace_nesting_level_ == 1) {
658 stack_trace_nesting_level_++;
659 base::OS::PrintError(
660 "\n\nAttempt to print stack while printing stack (double fault)\n");
661 base::OS::PrintError(
662 "If you are lucky you may find a partial stack dump on stdout.\n\n");
663 incomplete_message_->OutputToStdOut();
664 return factory()->empty_string();
665 } else {
666 base::OS::Abort();
667 }
668}
669
670void Isolate::PushStackTraceAndDie(void* ptr1, void* ptr2, void* ptr3,
671 void* ptr4) {
672 StackTraceFailureMessage message(this,
673 StackTraceFailureMessage::kIncludeStackTrace,
674 ptr1, ptr2, ptr3, ptr4);
675 message.Print();
676 base::OS::Abort();
677}
678
679void Isolate::PushParamsAndDie(void* ptr1, void* ptr2, void* ptr3, void* ptr4,
680 void* ptr5, void* ptr6) {
681 StackTraceFailureMessage message(
682 this, StackTraceFailureMessage::kDontIncludeStackTrace, ptr1, ptr2, ptr3,
683 ptr4, ptr5, ptr6);
684 message.Print();
685 base::OS::Abort();
686}
687
688void StackTraceFailureMessage::Print() volatile {
689 // Print the details of this failure message object, including its own address
690 // to force stack allocation.
691 base::OS::PrintError(
692 "Stacktrace:\n ptr1=%p\n ptr2=%p\n ptr3=%p\n ptr4=%p\n "
693 "ptr5=%p\n ptr6=%p\n failure_message_object=%p\n%s",
694 ptr1_, ptr2_, ptr3_, ptr4_, ptr5_, ptr6_, this, &js_stack_trace_[0]);
695}
696
697StackTraceFailureMessage::StackTraceFailureMessage(
698 Isolate* isolate, StackTraceFailureMessage::StackTraceMode mode, void* ptr1,
699 void* ptr2, void* ptr3, void* ptr4, void* ptr5, void* ptr6) {
700 isolate_ = isolate;
701 ptr1_ = ptr1;
702 ptr2_ = ptr2;
703 ptr3_ = ptr3;
704 ptr4_ = ptr4;
705 ptr5_ = ptr5;
706 ptr6_ = ptr6;
707 // Write a stracktrace into the {js_stack_trace_} buffer.
708 const size_t buffer_length = arraysize(js_stack_trace_);
709 memset(&js_stack_trace_, 0, buffer_length);
710 memset(&code_objects_, 0, sizeof(code_objects_));
711 if (mode == kIncludeStackTrace) {
712 FixedStringAllocator fixed(&js_stack_trace_[0], buffer_length - 1);
713 StringStream accumulator(&fixed, StringStream::kPrintObjectConcise);
714 isolate->PrintStack(&accumulator, Isolate::kPrintStackVerbose);
715 // Keeping a reference to the last code objects to increase likelihood that
716 // they get included in the minidump.
717 const size_t code_objects_length = arraysize(code_objects_);
718 size_t i = 0;
719 StackFrameIterator it(isolate);
720 for (; !it.done() && i < code_objects_length; it.Advance()) {
721 code_objects_[i++] =
722 reinterpret_cast<void*>(it.frame()->unchecked_code().ptr());
723 }
724 }
725}
726
727bool NoExtension(const v8::FunctionCallbackInfo<v8::Value>&) { return false; }
728
729namespace {
730
731bool IsBuiltinFunction(Isolate* isolate, Tagged<HeapObject> object,
732 Builtin builtin) {
733 if (!IsJSFunction(object)) return false;
734 Tagged<JSFunction> const function = JSFunction::cast(object);
735 // Currently we have to use full pointer comparison here as builtin Code
736 // objects are still inside the sandbox while runtime-generated Code objects
737 // are in trusted space.
738 static_assert(!kAllCodeObjectsLiveInTrustedSpace);
739 return function->code(isolate).SafeEquals(isolate->builtins()->code(builtin));
740}
741
742// Check if the function is one of the known async function or
743// async generator fulfill handlers.
744bool IsBuiltinAsyncFulfillHandler(Isolate* isolate, Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
745 return IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, object,
746 Builtin::kAsyncFunctionAwaitResolveClosure) ||
747 IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, object,
748 Builtin::kAsyncGeneratorAwaitResolveClosure) ||
749 IsBuiltinFunction(
750 isolate, object,
751 Builtin::kAsyncGeneratorYieldWithAwaitResolveClosure);
752}
753
754// Check if the function is one of the known async function or
755// async generator fulfill handlers.
756bool IsBuiltinAsyncRejectHandler(Isolate* isolate, Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
757 return IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, object,
758 Builtin::kAsyncFunctionAwaitRejectClosure) ||
759 IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, object,
760 Builtin::kAsyncGeneratorAwaitRejectClosure);
761}
762
763// Check if the function is one of the known builtin rejection handlers that
764// rethrows the exception instead of catching it.
765bool IsBuiltinForwardingRejectHandler(Isolate* isolate,
766 Tagged<HeapObject> object) {
767 return IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, object, Builtin::kPromiseCatchFinally) ||
768 IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, object,
769 Builtin::kAsyncFromSyncIteratorCloseSyncAndRethrow);
770}
771
772MaybeHandle<JSGeneratorObject> TryGetAsyncGenerator(
773 Isolate* isolate, Handle<PromiseReaction> reaction) {
774 // Check if the {reaction} has one of the known async function or
775 // async generator continuations as its fulfill handler.
776 if (IsBuiltinAsyncFulfillHandler(isolate, reaction->fulfill_handler())) {
777 // Now peek into the handlers' AwaitContext to get to
778 // the JSGeneratorObject for the async function.
779 Handle<Context> context(
780 JSFunction::cast(reaction->fulfill_handler())->context(), isolate);
781 Handle<JSGeneratorObject> generator_object(
782 JSGeneratorObject::cast(context->extension()), isolate);
783 return generator_object;
784 }
785 return MaybeHandle<JSGeneratorObject>();
786}
787
788int GetGeneratorBytecodeOffset(Handle<JSGeneratorObject> generator_object) {
789 // The stored bytecode offset is relative to a different base than what
790 // is used in the source position table, hence the subtraction.
791 return Smi::ToInt(generator_object->input_or_debug_pos()) -
792 (BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag);
793}
794
795class CallSiteBuilder {
796 public:
797 CallSiteBuilder(Isolate* isolate, FrameSkipMode mode, int limit,
798 Handle<Object> caller)
799 : isolate_(isolate),
800 mode_(mode),
801 limit_(limit),
802 caller_(caller),
803 skip_next_frame_(mode != SKIP_NONE) {
804 DCHECK_IMPLIES(mode_ == SKIP_UNTIL_SEEN, IsJSFunction(*caller_));
805 // Modern web applications are usually built with multiple layers of
806 // framework and library code, and stack depth tends to be more than
807 // a dozen frames, so we over-allocate a bit here to avoid growing
808 // the elements array in the common case.
809 elements_ = isolate->factory()->NewFixedArray(std::min(64, limit));
810 }
811
812 bool Visit(FrameSummary const& summary) {
813 if (Full()) return false;
814#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
815 if (summary.IsWasm()) {
816 AppendWasmFrame(summary.AsWasm());
817 return true;
818 }
819 if (summary.IsWasmInlined()) {
820 AppendWasmInlinedFrame(summary.AsWasmInlined());
821 return true;
822 }
823 if (summary.IsBuiltin()) {
824 AppendBuiltinFrame(summary.AsBuiltin());
825 return true;
826 }
827#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
828 AppendJavaScriptFrame(summary.AsJavaScript());
829 return true;
830 }
831
832 void AppendAsyncFrame(Handle<JSGeneratorObject> generator_object) {
833 Handle<JSFunction> function(generator_object->function(), isolate_);
834 if (!IsVisibleInStackTrace(function)) return;
835 int flags = CallSiteInfo::kIsAsync;
836 if (IsStrictFrame(function)) flags |= CallSiteInfo::kIsStrict;
837
838 Handle<Object> receiver(generator_object->receiver(), isolate_);
839 Handle<BytecodeArray> code(function->shared()->GetBytecodeArray(isolate_),
840 isolate_);
841 int offset = GetGeneratorBytecodeOffset(generator_object);
842
843 Handle<FixedArray> parameters = isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array();
844 if (V8_UNLIKELY(v8_flags.detailed_error_stack_trace)) {
845 parameters = isolate_->factory()->CopyFixedArrayUpTo(
846 handle(generator_object->parameters_and_registers(), isolate_),
847 function->shared()
848 ->internal_formal_parameter_count_without_receiver());
849 }
850
851 AppendFrame(receiver, function, code, offset, flags, parameters);
852 }
853
854 void AppendPromiseCombinatorFrame(Handle<JSFunction> element_function,
855 Handle<JSFunction> combinator) {
856 if (!IsVisibleInStackTrace(combinator)) return;
857 int flags =
858 CallSiteInfo::kIsAsync | CallSiteInfo::kIsSourcePositionComputed;
859
860 Handle<Object> receiver(combinator->native_context()->promise_function(),
861 isolate_);
862 Handle<Code> code(combinator->code(isolate_), isolate_);
863
864 // TODO(mmarchini) save Promises list from the Promise combinator
865 Handle<FixedArray> parameters = isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array();
866
867 // We store the offset of the promise into the element function's
868 // hash field for element callbacks.
869 int promise_index = Smi::ToInt(element_function->GetIdentityHash()) - 1;
870
871 AppendFrame(receiver, combinator, code, promise_index, flags, parameters);
872 }
873
874 void AppendJavaScriptFrame(
875 FrameSummary::JavaScriptFrameSummary const& summary) {
876 // Filter out internal frames that we do not want to show.
877 if (!IsVisibleInStackTrace(summary.function())) return;
878
879 int flags = 0;
880 Handle<JSFunction> function = summary.function();
881 if (IsStrictFrame(function)) flags |= CallSiteInfo::kIsStrict;
882 if (summary.is_constructor()) flags |= CallSiteInfo::kIsConstructor;
883
884 AppendFrame(summary.receiver(), function, summary.abstract_code(),
885 summary.code_offset(), flags, summary.parameters());
886 }
887
888#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
889 void AppendWasmFrame(FrameSummary::WasmFrameSummary const& summary) {
890 if (summary.code()->kind() != wasm::WasmCode::kWasmFunction) return;
891 Handle<WasmInstanceObject> instance = summary.wasm_instance();
892 int flags = CallSiteInfo::kIsWasm;
893 if (instance->module_object()->is_asm_js()) {
894 flags |= CallSiteInfo::kIsAsmJsWasm;
895 if (summary.at_to_number_conversion()) {
896 flags |= CallSiteInfo::kIsAsmJsAtNumberConversion;
897 }
898 }
899
900 Handle<HeapObject> code = isolate_->factory()->undefined_value();
901 AppendFrame(instance,
902 handle(Smi::FromInt(summary.function_index()), isolate_), code,
903 summary.code_offset(), flags,
904 isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array());
905 }
906
907 void AppendWasmInlinedFrame(
908 FrameSummary::WasmInlinedFrameSummary const& summary) {
909 Handle<HeapObject> code = isolate_->factory()->undefined_value();
910 int flags = CallSiteInfo::kIsWasm;
911 AppendFrame(summary.wasm_instance(),
912 handle(Smi::FromInt(summary.function_index()), isolate_), code,
913 summary.code_offset(), flags,
914 isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array());
915 }
916
917 void AppendBuiltinFrame(FrameSummary::BuiltinFrameSummary const& summary) {
918 Builtin builtin = summary.builtin();
919 Handle<Code> code = isolate_->builtins()->code_handle(builtin);
920 Handle<Object> function(Smi::FromInt(static_cast<int>(builtin)), isolate_);
921 int flags = CallSiteInfo::kIsBuiltin;
922 AppendFrame(summary.receiver(), function, code, summary.code_offset(),
923 flags, isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array());
924 }
925#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
926
927 bool Full() { return index_ >= limit_; }
928
929 Handle<FixedArray> Build() {
930 return FixedArray::RightTrimOrEmpty(isolate_, elements_, index_);
931 }
932
933 private:
934 // Poison stack frames below the first strict mode frame.
935 // The stack trace API should not expose receivers and function
936 // objects on frames deeper than the top-most one with a strict mode
937 // function.
938 bool IsStrictFrame(Handle<JSFunction> function) {
939 if (!encountered_strict_function_) {
940 encountered_strict_function_ =
941 is_strict(function->shared()->language_mode());
942 }
943 return encountered_strict_function_;
944 }
945
946 // Determines whether the given stack frame should be displayed in a stack
947 // trace.
948 bool IsVisibleInStackTrace(Handle<JSFunction> function) {
949 return ShouldIncludeFrame(function) && IsNotHidden(function);
950 }
951
952 // This mechanism excludes a number of uninteresting frames from the stack
953 // trace. This can be be the first frame (which will be a builtin-exit frame
954 // for the error constructor builtin) or every frame until encountering a
955 // user-specified function.
956 bool ShouldIncludeFrame(Handle<JSFunction> function) {
957 switch (mode_) {
958 case SKIP_NONE:
959 return true;
960 case SKIP_FIRST:
961 if (!skip_next_frame_) return true;
962 skip_next_frame_ = false;
963 return false;
964 case SKIP_UNTIL_SEEN:
965 if (skip_next_frame_ && (*function == *caller_)) {
966 skip_next_frame_ = false;
967 return false;
968 }
969 return !skip_next_frame_;
970 }
971 UNREACHABLE();
972 }
973
974 bool IsNotHidden(Handle<JSFunction> function) {
975 // TODO(szuend): Remove this check once the flag is enabled
976 // by default.
977 if (!v8_flags.experimental_stack_trace_frames &&
978 function->shared()->IsApiFunction()) {
979 return false;
980 }
981 // Functions defined not in user scripts are not visible unless directly
982 // exposed, in which case the native flag is set.
983 // The --builtins-in-stack-traces command line flag allows including
984 // internal call sites in the stack trace for debugging purposes.
985 if (!v8_flags.builtins_in_stack_traces &&
986 !function->shared()->IsUserJavaScript()) {
987 return function->shared()->native() ||
988 function->shared()->IsApiFunction();
989 }
990 return true;
991 }
992
993 void AppendFrame(Handle<Object> receiver_or_instance, Handle<Object> function,
994 Handle<HeapObject> code, int offset, int flags,
995 Handle<FixedArray> parameters) {
996 if (IsTheHole(*receiver_or_instance, isolate_)) {
997 // TODO(jgruber): Fix all cases in which frames give us a hole value
998 // (e.g. the receiver in RegExp constructor frames).
999 receiver_or_instance = isolate_->factory()->undefined_value();
1000 }
1001 auto info = isolate_->factory()->NewCallSiteInfo(
1002 receiver_or_instance, function, code, offset, flags, parameters);
1003 elements_ = FixedArray::SetAndGrow(isolate_, elements_, index_++, info);
1004 }
1005
1006 Isolate* isolate_;
1007 const FrameSkipMode mode_;
1008 int index_ = 0;
1009 const int limit_;
1010 const Handle<Object> caller_;
1011 bool skip_next_frame_;
1012 bool encountered_strict_function_ = false;
1013 Handle<FixedArray> elements_;
1014};
1015
1016bool GetStackTraceLimit(Isolate* isolate, int* result) {
1017 if (v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions) return false;
1018 Handle<JSObject> error = isolate->error_function();
1019
1020 Handle<String> key = isolate->factory()->stackTraceLimit_string();
1021 Handle<Object> stack_trace_limit =
1022 JSReceiver::GetDataProperty(isolate, error, key);
1023 if (!IsNumber(*stack_trace_limit)) return false;
1024
1025 // Ensure that limit is not negative.
1026 *result = std::max(FastD2IChecked(Object::Number(*stack_trace_limit)), 0);
1027
1028 if (*result != v8_flags.stack_trace_limit) {
1029 isolate->CountUsage(v8::Isolate::kErrorStackTraceLimit);
1030 }
1031
1032 return true;
1033}
1034
1035void CaptureAsyncStackTrace(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSPromise> promise,
1036 CallSiteBuilder* builder) {
1037 while (!builder->Full()) {
1038 // Check that the {promise} is not settled.
1039 if (promise->status() != Promise::kPending) return;
1040
1041 // Check that we have exactly one PromiseReaction on the {promise}.
1042 if (!IsPromiseReaction(promise->reactions())) return;
1043 Handle<PromiseReaction> reaction(
1044 PromiseReaction::cast(promise->reactions()), isolate);
1045 if (!IsSmi(reaction->next())) return;
1046
1047 Handle<JSGeneratorObject> generator_object;
1048
1049 if (TryGetAsyncGenerator(isolate, reaction).ToHandle(&generator_object)) {
1050 CHECK(generator_object->is_suspended());
1051
1052 // Append async frame corresponding to the {generator_object}.
1053 builder->AppendAsyncFrame(generator_object);
1054
1055 // Try to continue from here.
1056 if (IsJSAsyncFunctionObject(*generator_object)) {
1057 Handle<JSAsyncFunctionObject> async_function_object =
1058 Handle<JSAsyncFunctionObject>::cast(generator_object);
1059 promise = handle(async_function_object->promise(), isolate);
1060 } else {
1061 Handle<JSAsyncGeneratorObject> async_generator_object =
1062 Handle<JSAsyncGeneratorObject>::cast(generator_object);
1063 if (IsUndefined(async_generator_object->queue(), isolate)) return;
1064 Handle<AsyncGeneratorRequest> async_generator_request(
1065 AsyncGeneratorRequest::cast(async_generator_object->queue()),
1066 isolate);
1067 promise = handle(JSPromise::cast(async_generator_request->promise()),
1068 isolate);
1069 }
1070 } else if (IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, reaction->fulfill_handler(),
1071 Builtin::kPromiseAllResolveElementClosure)) {
1072 Handle<JSFunction> function(JSFunction::cast(reaction->fulfill_handler()),
1073 isolate);
1074 Handle<Context> context(function->context(), isolate);
1075 Handle<JSFunction> combinator(context->native_context()->promise_all(),
1076 isolate);
1077 builder->AppendPromiseCombinatorFrame(function, combinator);
1078
1079 if (IsNativeContext(*context)) {
1080 // NativeContext is used as a marker that the closure was already
1081 // called. We can't access the reject element context any more.
1082 return;
1083 }
1084
1085 // Now peek into the Promise.all() resolve element context to
1086 // find the promise capability that's being resolved when all
1087 // the concurrent promises resolve.
1088 int const index =
1089 PromiseBuiltins::kPromiseAllResolveElementCapabilitySlot;
1090 Handle<PromiseCapability> capability(
1091 PromiseCapability::cast(context->get(index)), isolate);
1092 if (!IsJSPromise(capability->promise())) return;
1093 promise = handle(JSPromise::cast(capability->promise()), isolate);
1094 } else if (IsBuiltinFunction(
1095 isolate, reaction->fulfill_handler(),
1096 Builtin::kPromiseAllSettledResolveElementClosure)) {
1097 Handle<JSFunction> function(JSFunction::cast(reaction->fulfill_handler()),
1098 isolate);
1099 Handle<Context> context(function->context(), isolate);
1100 Handle<JSFunction> combinator(
1101 context->native_context()->promise_all_settled(), isolate);
1102 builder->AppendPromiseCombinatorFrame(function, combinator);
1103
1104 if (IsNativeContext(*context)) {
1105 // NativeContext is used as a marker that the closure was already
1106 // called. We can't access the reject element context any more.
1107 return;
1108 }
1109
1110 // Now peek into the Promise.allSettled() resolve element context to
1111 // find the promise capability that's being resolved when all
1112 // the concurrent promises resolve.
1113 int const index =
1114 PromiseBuiltins::kPromiseAllResolveElementCapabilitySlot;
1115 Handle<PromiseCapability> capability(
1116 PromiseCapability::cast(context->get(index)), isolate);
1117 if (!IsJSPromise(capability->promise())) return;
1118 promise = handle(JSPromise::cast(capability->promise()), isolate);
1119 } else if (IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, reaction->reject_handler(),
1120 Builtin::kPromiseAnyRejectElementClosure)) {
1121 Handle<JSFunction> function(JSFunction::cast(reaction->reject_handler()),
1122 isolate);
1123 Handle<Context> context(function->context(), isolate);
1124 Handle<JSFunction> combinator(context->native_context()->promise_any(),
1125 isolate);
1126 builder->AppendPromiseCombinatorFrame(function, combinator);
1127
1128 if (IsNativeContext(*context)) {
1129 // NativeContext is used as a marker that the closure was already
1130 // called. We can't access the reject element context any more.
1131 return;
1132 }
1133
1134 // Now peek into the Promise.any() reject element context to
1135 // find the promise capability that's being resolved when any of
1136 // the concurrent promises resolve.
1137 int const index = PromiseBuiltins::kPromiseAnyRejectElementCapabilitySlot;
1138 Handle<PromiseCapability> capability(
1139 PromiseCapability::cast(context->get(index)), isolate);
1140 if (!IsJSPromise(capability->promise())) return;
1141 promise = handle(JSPromise::cast(capability->promise()), isolate);
1142 } else if (IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, reaction->fulfill_handler(),
1143 Builtin::kPromiseCapabilityDefaultResolve)) {
1144 Handle<JSFunction> function(JSFunction::cast(reaction->fulfill_handler()),
1145 isolate);
1146 Handle<Context> context(function->context(), isolate);
1147 promise =
1148 handle(JSPromise::cast(context->get(PromiseBuiltins::kPromiseSlot)),
1149 isolate);
1150 } else {
1151 // We have some generic promise chain here, so try to
1152 // continue with the chained promise on the reaction
1153 // (only works for native promise chains).
1154 Handle<HeapObject> promise_or_capability(
1155 reaction->promise_or_capability(), isolate);
1156 if (IsJSPromise(*promise_or_capability)) {
1157 promise = Handle<JSPromise>::cast(promise_or_capability);
1158 } else if (IsPromiseCapability(*promise_or_capability)) {
1159 Handle<PromiseCapability> capability =
1160 Handle<PromiseCapability>::cast(promise_or_capability);
1161 if (!IsJSPromise(capability->promise())) return;
1162 promise = handle(JSPromise::cast(capability->promise()), isolate);
1163 } else {
1164 // Otherwise the {promise_or_capability} must be undefined here.
1165 CHECK(IsUndefined(*promise_or_capability, isolate));
1166 return;
1167 }
1168 }
1169 }
1170}
1171
1172MaybeHandle<JSPromise> TryGetCurrentTaskPromise(Isolate* isolate) {
1173 Handle<Object> current_microtask = isolate->factory()->current_microtask();
1174 if (IsPromiseReactionJobTask(*current_microtask)) {
1175 Handle<PromiseReactionJobTask> promise_reaction_job_task =
1176 Handle<PromiseReactionJobTask>::cast(current_microtask);
1177 // Check if the {reaction} has one of the known async function or
1178 // async generator continuations as its fulfill handler.
1179 if (IsBuiltinAsyncFulfillHandler(isolate,
1180 promise_reaction_job_task->handler()) ||
1181 IsBuiltinAsyncRejectHandler(isolate,
1182 promise_reaction_job_task->handler())) {
1183 // Now peek into the handlers' AwaitContext to get to
1184 // the JSGeneratorObject for the async function.
1185 Handle<Context> context(
1186 JSFunction::cast(promise_reaction_job_task->handler())->context(),
1187 isolate);
1188 Handle<JSGeneratorObject> generator_object(
1189 JSGeneratorObject::cast(context->extension()), isolate);
1190 if (generator_object->is_executing()) {
1191 if (IsJSAsyncFunctionObject(*generator_object)) {
1192 Handle<JSAsyncFunctionObject> async_function_object =
1193 Handle<JSAsyncFunctionObject>::cast(generator_object);
1194 Handle<JSPromise> promise(async_function_object->promise(), isolate);
1195 return promise;
1196 } else {
1197 Handle<JSAsyncGeneratorObject> async_generator_object =
1198 Handle<JSAsyncGeneratorObject>::cast(generator_object);
1199 Handle<Object> queue(async_generator_object->queue(), isolate);
1200 if (!IsUndefined(*queue, isolate)) {
1201 Handle<AsyncGeneratorRequest> async_generator_request =
1202 Handle<AsyncGeneratorRequest>::cast(queue);
1203 Handle<JSPromise> promise(
1204 JSPromise::cast(async_generator_request->promise()), isolate);
1205 return promise;
1206 }
1207 }
1208 }
1209 } else {
1210 // The {promise_reaction_job_task} doesn't belong to an await (or
1211 // yield inside an async generator), but we might still be able to
1212 // find an async frame if we follow along the chain of promises on
1213 // the {promise_reaction_job_task}.
1214 Handle<HeapObject> promise_or_capability(
1215 promise_reaction_job_task->promise_or_capability(), isolate);
1216 if (IsJSPromise(*promise_or_capability)) {
1217 Handle<JSPromise> promise =
1218 Handle<JSPromise>::cast(promise_or_capability);
1219 return promise;
1220 }
1221 }
1222 }
1223 return MaybeHandle<JSPromise>();
1224}
1225
1226void CaptureAsyncStackTrace(Isolate* isolate, CallSiteBuilder* builder) {
1227 Handle<JSPromise> promise;
1228 if (TryGetCurrentTaskPromise(isolate).ToHandle(&promise)) {
1229 CaptureAsyncStackTrace(isolate, promise, builder);
1230 }
1231}
1232
1233template <typename Visitor>
1234void VisitStack(Isolate* isolate, Visitor* visitor,
1235 StackTrace::StackTraceOptions options = StackTrace::kDetailed) {
1236 DisallowJavascriptExecution no_js(isolate);
1237 for (StackFrameIterator it(isolate); !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
1238 StackFrame* frame = it.frame();
1239 switch (frame->type()) {
1240 case StackFrame::API_CALLBACK_EXIT:
1241 case StackFrame::BUILTIN_EXIT:
1242 case StackFrame::JAVA_SCRIPT_BUILTIN_CONTINUATION:
1243 case StackFrame::JAVA_SCRIPT_BUILTIN_CONTINUATION_WITH_CATCH:
1244 case StackFrame::TURBOFAN:
1245 case StackFrame::MAGLEV:
1246 case StackFrame::INTERPRETED:
1247 case StackFrame::BASELINE:
1248 case StackFrame::BUILTIN:
1249#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1250 case StackFrame::STUB:
1251 case StackFrame::WASM:
1252#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1253 {
1254 // A standard frame may include many summarized frames (due to
1255 // inlining).
1256 std::vector<FrameSummary> summaries;
1257 CommonFrame::cast(frame)->Summarize(&summaries);
1258 for (auto rit = summaries.rbegin(); rit != summaries.rend(); ++rit) {
1259 FrameSummary& summary = *rit;
1260 // Skip frames from other origins when asked to do so.
1261 if (!(options & StackTrace::kExposeFramesAcrossSecurityOrigins) &&
1262 !summary.native_context()->HasSameSecurityTokenAs(
1263 isolate->context())) {
1264 continue;
1265 }
1266 if (!visitor->Visit(summary)) return;
1267 }
1268 break;
1269 }
1270
1271 default:
1272 break;
1273 }
1274 }
1275}
1276
1277Handle<FixedArray> CaptureSimpleStackTrace(Isolate* isolate, int limit,
1278 FrameSkipMode mode,
1279 Handle<Object> caller) {
1280 TRACE_EVENT_BEGIN1(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.stack_trace"), __func__,
1281 "maxFrameCount", limit);
1282
1283#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1284 wasm::WasmCodeRefScope code_ref_scope;
1285#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1286
1287 CallSiteBuilder builder(isolate, mode, limit, caller);
1288 VisitStack(isolate, &builder);
1289
1290 // If --async-stack-traces are enabled and the "current microtask" is a
1291 // PromiseReactionJobTask, we try to enrich the stack trace with async
1292 // frames.
1293 if (v8_flags.async_stack_traces) {
1294 CaptureAsyncStackTrace(isolate, &builder);
1295 }
1296
1297 Handle<FixedArray> stack_trace = builder.Build();
1298 TRACE_EVENT_END1(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.stack_trace"), __func__,
1299 "frameCount", stack_trace->length());
1300 return stack_trace;
1301}
1302
1303} // namespace
1304
1305MaybeHandle<JSObject> Isolate::CaptureAndSetErrorStack(
1306 Handle<JSObject> error_object, FrameSkipMode mode, Handle<Object> caller) {
1307 TRACE_EVENT0(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.stack_trace"), __func__);
1308 Handle<Object> error_stack = factory()->undefined_value();
1309
1310 // Capture the "simple stack trace" for the error.stack property,
1311 // which can be disabled by setting Error.stackTraceLimit to a non
1312 // number value or simply deleting the property. If the inspector
1313 // is active, and requests more stack frames than the JavaScript
1314 // program itself, we collect up to the maximum.
1315 int stack_trace_limit = 0;
1316 if (GetStackTraceLimit(this, &stack_trace_limit)) {
1317 int limit = stack_trace_limit;
1318 if (capture_stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_ &&
1319 !(stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_options_ &
1320 StackTrace::kExposeFramesAcrossSecurityOrigins)) {
1321 // Collect up to the maximum of what the JavaScript program and
1322 // the inspector want. There's a special case here where the API
1323 // can ask the stack traces to also include cross-origin frames,
1324 // in which case we collect a separate trace below. Note that
1325 // the inspector doesn't use this option, so we could as well
1326 // just deprecate this in the future.
1327 if (limit < stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_frame_limit_) {
1328 limit = stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_frame_limit_;
1329 }
1330 }
1331 error_stack = CaptureSimpleStackTrace(this, limit, mode, caller);
1332 }
1333
1334 // Next is the inspector part: Depending on whether we got a "simple
1335 // stack trace" above and whether that's usable (meaning the API
1336 // didn't request to include cross-origin frames), we remember the
1337 // cap for the stack trace (either a positive limit indicating that
1338 // the Error.stackTraceLimit value was below what was requested via
1339 // the API, or a negative limit to indicate the opposite), or we
1340 // collect a "detailed stack trace" eagerly and stash that away.
1341 if (capture_stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_) {
1342 Handle<Object> limit_or_stack_frame_infos;
1343 if (IsUndefined(*error_stack, this) ||
1344 (stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_options_ &
1345 StackTrace::kExposeFramesAcrossSecurityOrigins)) {
1346 limit_or_stack_frame_infos = CaptureDetailedStackTrace(
1347 stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_frame_limit_,
1348 stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_options_);
1349 } else {
1350 int limit =
1351 stack_trace_limit > stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_frame_limit_
1352 ? -stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_frame_limit_
1353 : stack_trace_limit;
1354 limit_or_stack_frame_infos = handle(Smi::FromInt(limit), this);
1355 }
1356 error_stack =
1357 factory()->NewErrorStackData(error_stack, limit_or_stack_frame_infos);
1358 }
1359
1360 RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION(
1361 this,
1362 Object::SetProperty(this, error_object, factory()->error_stack_symbol(),
1363 error_stack, StoreOrigin::kMaybeKeyed,
1364 Just(ShouldThrow::kThrowOnError)),
1365 JSObject);
1366 return error_object;
1367}
1368
1369Handle<FixedArray> Isolate::GetDetailedStackTrace(
1370 Handle<JSReceiver> maybe_error_object) {
1371 ErrorUtils::StackPropertyLookupResult lookup =
1372 ErrorUtils::GetErrorStackProperty(this, maybe_error_object);
1373
1374 if (!IsErrorStackData(*lookup.error_stack)) return {};
1375 Handle<ErrorStackData> error_stack_data =
1376 Handle<ErrorStackData>::cast(lookup.error_stack);
1377
1378 ErrorStackData::EnsureStackFrameInfos(this, error_stack_data);
1379
1380 if (!IsFixedArray(error_stack_data->limit_or_stack_frame_infos())) return {};
1381 return handle(
1382 FixedArray::cast(error_stack_data->limit_or_stack_frame_infos()), this);
1383}
1384
1385Handle<FixedArray> Isolate::GetSimpleStackTrace(
1386 Handle<JSReceiver> maybe_error_object) {
1387 ErrorUtils::StackPropertyLookupResult lookup =
1388 ErrorUtils::GetErrorStackProperty(this, maybe_error_object);
1389
1390 if (IsFixedArray(*lookup.error_stack)) {
1391 return Handle<FixedArray>::cast(lookup.error_stack);
1392 }
1393 if (!IsErrorStackData(*lookup.error_stack)) {
1394 return factory()->empty_fixed_array();
1395 }
1396 Handle<ErrorStackData> error_stack_data =
1397 Handle<ErrorStackData>::cast(lookup.error_stack);
1398 if (!error_stack_data->HasCallSiteInfos()) {
1399 return factory()->empty_fixed_array();
1400 }
1401 return handle(error_stack_data->call_site_infos(), this);
1402}
1403
1404Address Isolate::GetAbstractPC(int* line, int* column) {
1405 JavaScriptStackFrameIterator it(this);
1406
1407 if (it.done()) {
1408 *line = -1;
1409 *column = -1;
1410 return kNullAddress;
1411 }
1412 JavaScriptFrame* frame = it.frame();
1413 DCHECK(!frame->is_builtin());
1414
1415 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared = handle(frame->function()->shared(), this);
1416 SharedFunctionInfo::EnsureSourcePositionsAvailable(this, shared);
1417 int position = frame->position();
1418
1419 Tagged<Object> maybe_script = frame->function()->shared()->script();
1420 if (IsScript(maybe_script)) {
1421 Handle<Script> script(Script::cast(maybe_script), this);
1422 Script::PositionInfo info;
1423 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, position, &info);
1424 *line = info.line + 1;
1425 *column = info.column + 1;
1426 } else {
1427 *line = position;
1428 *column = -1;
1429 }
1430
1431 if (frame->is_unoptimized()) {
1432 UnoptimizedFrame* iframe = static_cast<UnoptimizedFrame*>(frame);
1433 Address bytecode_start =
1434 iframe->GetBytecodeArray()->GetFirstBytecodeAddress();
1435 return bytecode_start + iframe->GetBytecodeOffset();
1436 }
1437
1438 return frame->pc();
1439}
1440
1441namespace {
1442
1443class StackFrameBuilder {
1444 public:
1445 StackFrameBuilder(Isolate* isolate, int limit)
1446 : isolate_(isolate),
1447 frames_(isolate_->factory()->empty_fixed_array()),
1448 index_(0),
1449 limit_(limit) {}
1450
1451 bool Visit(FrameSummary& summary) {
1452 // Check if we have enough capacity left.
1453 if (index_ >= limit_) return false;
1454 // Skip frames that aren't subject to debugging.
1455 if (!summary.is_subject_to_debugging()) return true;
1456 Handle<StackFrameInfo> frame = summary.CreateStackFrameInfo();
1457 frames_ = FixedArray::SetAndGrow(isolate_, frames_, index_++, frame);
1458 return true;
1459 }
1460
1461 Handle<FixedArray> Build() {
1462 return FixedArray::RightTrimOrEmpty(isolate_, frames_, index_);
1463 }
1464
1465 private:
1466 Isolate* isolate_;
1467 Handle<FixedArray> frames_;
1468 int index_;
1469 int limit_;
1470};
1471
1472} // namespace
1473
1474Handle<FixedArray> Isolate::CaptureDetailedStackTrace(
1475 int limit, StackTrace::StackTraceOptions options) {
1476 TRACE_EVENT_BEGIN1(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.stack_trace"), __func__,
1477 "maxFrameCount", limit);
1478 StackFrameBuilder builder(this, limit);
1479 VisitStack(this, &builder, options);
1480 Handle<FixedArray> stack_trace = builder.Build();
1481 TRACE_EVENT_END1(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.stack_trace"), __func__,
1482 "frameCount", stack_trace->length());
1483 return stack_trace;
1484}
