1486namespace {
1487
1488class CurrentScriptNameStackVisitor {
1489 public:
1490 explicit CurrentScriptNameStackVisitor(Isolate* isolate)
1491 : isolate_(isolate) {}
1492
1493 bool Visit(FrameSummary& summary) {
1494 // Skip frames that aren't subject to debugging. Keep this in sync with
1495 // StackFrameBuilder::Visit so both visitors visit the same frames.
1496 if (!summary.is_subject_to_debugging()) return true;
1497
1498 // Frames that are subject to debugging always have a valid script object.
1499 Handle<Script> script = Handle<Script>::cast(summary.script());
1500 Handle<Object> name_or_url_obj =
1501 handle(script->GetNameOrSourceURL(), isolate_);
1502 if (!IsString(*name_or_url_obj)) return true;
1503
1504 Handle<String> name_or_url = Handle<String>::cast(name_or_url_obj);
1505 if (!name_or_url->length()) return true;
1506
1507 name_or_url_ = name_or_url;
1508 return false;
1509 }
1510
1511 Handle<String> CurrentScriptNameOrSourceURL() const { return name_or_url_; }
1512
1513 private:
1514 Isolate* const isolate_;
1515 Handle<String> name_or_url_;
1516};
1517
1518} // namespace
1519
1520Handle<String> Isolate::CurrentScriptNameOrSourceURL() {
1521 TRACE_EVENT0(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.stack_trace"), __func__);
1522 CurrentScriptNameStackVisitor visitor(this);
1523 VisitStack(this, &visitor);
1524 return visitor.CurrentScriptNameOrSourceURL();
1525}
1526
1527void Isolate::PrintStack(FILE* out, PrintStackMode mode) {
1528 if (stack_trace_nesting_level_ == 0) {
1529 stack_trace_nesting_level_++;
1530 StringStream::ClearMentionedObjectCache(this);
1531 HeapStringAllocator allocator;
1532 StringStream accumulator(&allocator);
1533 incomplete_message_ = &accumulator;
1534 PrintStack(&accumulator, mode);
1535 accumulator.OutputToFile(out);
1536 InitializeLoggingAndCounters();
1537 accumulator.Log(this);
1538 incomplete_message_ = nullptr;
1539 stack_trace_nesting_level_ = 0;
1540 } else if (stack_trace_nesting_level_ == 1) {
1541 stack_trace_nesting_level_++;
1542 base::OS::PrintError(
1543 "\n\nAttempt to print stack while printing stack (double fault)\n");
1544 base::OS::PrintError(
1545 "If you are lucky you may find a partial stack dump on stdout.\n\n");
1546 incomplete_message_->OutputToFile(out);
1547 }
1548}
1549
1550static void PrintFrames(Isolate* isolate, StringStream* accumulator,
1551 StackFrame::PrintMode mode) {
1552 StackFrameIterator it(isolate);
1553 for (int i = 0; !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
1554 it.frame()->Print(accumulator, mode, i++);
1555 }
1556}
1557
1558void Isolate::PrintStack(StringStream* accumulator, PrintStackMode mode) {
1559 HandleScope scope(this);
1560 DCHECK(accumulator->IsMentionedObjectCacheClear(this));
1561
1562 // Avoid printing anything if there are no frames.
1563 if (c_entry_fp(thread_local_top()) == 0) return;
1564
1565 accumulator->Add(
1566 "\n==== JS stack trace =========================================\n\n");
1567 PrintFrames(this, accumulator, StackFrame::OVERVIEW);
1568 if (mode == kPrintStackVerbose) {
1569 accumulator->Add(
1570 "\n==== Details ================================================\n\n");
1571 PrintFrames(this, accumulator, StackFrame::DETAILS);
1572 accumulator->PrintMentionedObjectCache(this);
1573 }
1574 accumulator->Add("=====================\n\n");
1575}
1576
1577void Isolate::SetFailedAccessCheckCallback(
1578 v8::FailedAccessCheckCallback callback) {
1579 thread_local_top()->failed_access_check_callback_ = callback;
1580}
1581
1582MaybeHandle<Object> Isolate::ReportFailedAccessCheck(
1583 Handle<JSObject> receiver) {
1584 if (!thread_local_top()->failed_access_check_callback_) {
1585 THROW_NEW_ERROR(this, NewTypeError(MessageTemplate::kNoAccess), Object);
1586 }
1587
1588 DCHECK(IsAccessCheckNeeded(*receiver));
1589 DCHECK(!context().is_null());
1590
1591 // Get the data object from access check info.
1592 HandleScope scope(this);
1593 Handle<Object> data;
1594 {
1595 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1596 Tagged<AccessCheckInfo> access_check_info =
1597 AccessCheckInfo::Get(this, receiver);
1598 if (access_check_info.is_null()) {
1599 no_gc.Release();
1600 THROW_NEW_ERROR(this, NewTypeError(MessageTemplate::kNoAccess), Object);
1601 }
1602 data = handle(access_check_info->data(), this);
1603 }
1604
1605 {
1606 // Leaving JavaScript.
1607 VMState<EXTERNAL> state(this);
1608 thread_local_top()->failed_access_check_callback_(
1609 v8::Utils::ToLocal(receiver), v8::ACCESS_HAS, v8::Utils::ToLocal(data));
1610 }
1611 RETURN_VALUE_IF_EXCEPTION(this, {});
1612 // Throw exception even the callback forgot to do so.
1613 THROW_NEW_ERROR(this, NewTypeError(MessageTemplate::kNoAccess), Object);
1614}
1615
1616bool Isolate::MayAccess(Handle<NativeContext> accessing_context,
1617 Handle<JSObject> receiver) {
1618 DCHECK(IsJSGlobalProxy(*receiver) || IsAccessCheckNeeded(*receiver));
1619
1620 // Check for compatibility between the security tokens in the
1621 // current lexical context and the accessed object.
1622
1623 // During bootstrapping, callback functions are not enabled yet.
1624 if (bootstrapper()->IsActive()) return true;
1625 {
1626 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1627
1628 if (IsJSGlobalProxy(*receiver)) {
1629 base::Optional<Tagged<Object>> receiver_context =
1630 JSGlobalProxy::cast(*receiver)->GetCreationContext();
1631 if (!receiver_context) return false;
1632
1633 if (*receiver_context == *accessing_context) return true;
1634
1635 if (Context::cast(*receiver_context)->security_token() ==
1636 accessing_context->security_token())
1637 return true;
1638 }
1639 }
1640
1641 HandleScope scope(this);
1642 Handle<Object> data;
1643 v8::AccessCheckCallback callback = nullptr;
1644 {
1645 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1646 Tagged<AccessCheckInfo> access_check_info =
1647 AccessCheckInfo::Get(this, receiver);
1648 if (access_check_info.is_null()) return false;
1649 Tagged<Object> fun_obj = access_check_info->callback();
1650 callback = v8::ToCData<v8::AccessCheckCallback>(fun_obj);
1651 data = handle(access_check_info->data(), this);
1652 }
1653
1654 {
1655 // Leaving JavaScript.
1656 VMState<EXTERNAL> state(this);
1657 return callback(v8::Utils::ToLocal(accessing_context),
1658 v8::Utils::ToLocal(receiver), v8::Utils::ToLocal(data));
1659 }
1660}
1661
1662Tagged<Object> Isolate::StackOverflow() {
1663 // Whoever calls this method should not have overflown the stack limit by too
1664 // much. Otherwise we risk actually running out of stack space.
1665 // We allow for up to 8kB overflow, because we typically allow up to 4KB
1666 // overflow per frame in generated code, but might call through more smaller
1667 // frames until we reach this method.
1668 // If this DCHECK fails, one of the frames on the stack should be augmented by
1669 // an additional stack check.
1670#if defined(V8_USE_ADDRESS_SANITIZER) || defined(MEMORY_SANITIZER)
1671 // Allow for a bit more overflow in sanitizer builds, because C++ frames take
1672 // significantly more space there.
1673 DCHECK_GE(GetCurrentStackPosition(), stack_guard()->real_climit() - 64 * KB);
1674#else
1675 DCHECK_GE(GetCurrentStackPosition(), stack_guard()->real_climit() - 8 * KB);
1676#endif
1677
1678 if (v8_flags.correctness_fuzzer_suppressions) {
1679 FATAL("Aborting on stack overflow");
1680 }
1681
1682 DisallowJavascriptExecution no_js(this);
1683 HandleScope scope(this);
1684
1685 Handle<JSFunction> fun = range_error_function();
1686 Handle<Object> msg = factory()->NewStringFromAsciiChecked(
1687 MessageFormatter::TemplateString(MessageTemplate::kStackOverflow));
1688 Handle<Object> options = factory()->undefined_value();
1689 Handle<Object> no_caller;
1690 Handle<JSObject> exception;
1691 ASSIGN_RETURN_FAILURE_ON_EXCEPTION(
1692 this, exception,
1693 ErrorUtils::Construct(this, fun, fun, msg, options, SKIP_NONE, no_caller,
1694 ErrorUtils::StackTraceCollection::kEnabled));
1695 JSObject::AddProperty(this, exception, factory()->wasm_uncatchable_symbol(),
1696 factory()->true_value(), NONE);
1697
1698 Throw(*exception);
1699
1700#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
1701 if (v8_flags.verify_heap && v8_flags.stress_compaction) {
1702 heap()->CollectAllGarbage(GCFlag::kNoFlags,
1703 GarbageCollectionReason::kTesting);
1704 }
1705#endif // VERIFY_HEAP
1706
1707 return ReadOnlyRoots(heap()).exception();
1708}
1709
1710Tagged<Object> Isolate::ThrowAt(Handle<JSObject> exception,
1711 MessageLocation* location) {
1712 Handle<Name> key_start_pos = factory()->error_start_pos_symbol();
1713 Object::SetProperty(this, exception, key_start_pos,
1714 handle(Smi::FromInt(location->start_pos()), this),
1715 StoreOrigin::kMaybeKeyed,
1716 Just(ShouldThrow::kThrowOnError))
1717 .Check();
1718
1719 Handle<Name> key_end_pos = factory()->error_end_pos_symbol();
1720 Object::SetProperty(this, exception, key_end_pos,
1721 handle(Smi::FromInt(location->end_pos()), this),
1722 StoreOrigin::kMaybeKeyed,
1723 Just(ShouldThrow::kThrowOnError))
1724 .Check();
1725
1726 Handle<Name> key_script = factory()->error_script_symbol();
1727 Object::SetProperty(this, exception, key_script, location->script(),
1728 StoreOrigin::kMaybeKeyed,
1729 Just(ShouldThrow::kThrowOnError))
1730 .Check();
1731
1732 return Throw(*exception, location);
1733}
1734
1735Tagged<Object> Isolate::TerminateExecution() {
1736 return Throw(ReadOnlyRoots(this).termination_exception());
1737}
1738
1739void Isolate::CancelTerminateExecution() {
1740 if (!is_execution_terminating()) return;
1741 clear_internal_exception();
1742 if (try_catch_handler()) try_catch_handler()->ResetInternal();
1743}
1744
1745void Isolate::RequestInterrupt(InterruptCallback callback, void* data) {
1746 ExecutionAccess access(this);
1747 api_interrupts_queue_.push(InterruptEntry(callback, data));
1748 stack_guard()->RequestApiInterrupt();
1749}
1750
1751void Isolate::InvokeApiInterruptCallbacks() {
1752 RCS_SCOPE(this, RuntimeCallCounterId::kInvokeApiInterruptCallbacks);
1753 // Note: callback below should be called outside of execution access lock.
1754 while (true) {
1755 InterruptEntry entry;
1756 {
1757 ExecutionAccess access(this);
1758 if (api_interrupts_queue_.empty()) return;
1759 entry = api_interrupts_queue_.front();
1760 api_interrupts_queue_.pop();
1761 }
1762 VMState<EXTERNAL> state(this);
1763 HandleScope handle_scope(this);
1764 entry.first(reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this), entry.second);
1765 }
1766}
1767
1768void Isolate::RequestInvalidateNoProfilingProtector() {
1769 // This request might be triggered from arbitrary thread but protector
1770 // invalidation must happen on the main thread, so use Api interrupt
1771 // to achieve that.
1772 RequestInterrupt(
1773 [](v8::Isolate* isolate, void*) {
1774 Isolate* i_isolate = reinterpret_cast<Isolate*>(isolate);
1775 if (Protectors::IsNoProfilingIntact(i_isolate)) {
1776 Protectors::InvalidateNoProfiling(i_isolate);
1777 }
1778 },
1779 nullptr);
1780}
1781
1782namespace {
1783
1784void ReportBootstrappingException(Handle<Object> exception,
1785 MessageLocation* location) {
1786 base::OS::PrintError("Exception thrown during bootstrapping\n");
1787 if (location == nullptr || location->script().is_null()) return;
1788 // We are bootstrapping and caught an error where the location is set
1789 // and we have a script for the location.
1790 // In this case we could have an extension (or an internal error
1791 // somewhere) and we print out the line number at which the error occurred
1792 // to the console for easier debugging.
1793 int line_number =
1794 location->script()->GetLineNumber(location->start_pos()) + 1;
1795 if (IsString(*exception) && IsString(location->script()->name())) {
1796 base::OS::PrintError(
1797 "Extension or internal compilation error: %s in %s at line %d.\n",
1798 String::cast(*exception)->ToCString().get(),
1799 String::cast(location->script()->name())->ToCString().get(),
1800 line_number);
1801 } else if (IsString(location->script()->name())) {
1802 base::OS::PrintError(
1803 "Extension or internal compilation error in %s at line %d.\n",
1804 String::cast(location->script()->name())->ToCString().get(),
1805 line_number);
1806 } else if (IsString(*exception)) {
1807 base::OS::PrintError("Extension or internal compilation error: %s.\n",
1808 String::cast(*exception)->ToCString().get());
1809 } else {
1810 base::OS::PrintError("Extension or internal compilation error.\n");
1811 }
1812#ifdef OBJECT_PRINT
1813 // Since comments and empty lines have been stripped from the source of
1814 // builtins, print the actual source here so that line numbers match.
1815 if (IsString(location->script()->source())) {
1816 Handle<String> src(String::cast(location->script()->source()),
1817 location->script()->GetIsolate());
1818 PrintF("Failing script:");
1819 int len = src->length();
1820 if (len == 0) {
1821 PrintF(" <not available>\n");
1822 } else {
1823 PrintF("\n");
1824 line_number = 1;
1825 PrintF("%5d: ", line_number);
1826 for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
1827 uint16_t character = src->Get(i);
1828 PrintF("%c", character);
1829 if (character == '\n' && i < len - 2) {
1830 PrintF("%5d: ", ++line_number);
1831 }
1832 }
1833 PrintF("\n");
1834 }
1835 }
1836#endif
1837}
1838
1839} // anonymous namespace
1840
1841Handle<JSMessageObject> Isolate::CreateMessageOrAbort(
1842 Handle<Object> exception, MessageLocation* location) {
1843 Handle<JSMessageObject> message_obj = CreateMessage(exception, location);
1844
1845 // If the abort-on-uncaught-exception flag is specified, and if the
1846 // embedder didn't specify a custom uncaught exception callback,
1847 // or if the custom callback determined that V8 should abort, then
1848 // abort.
1849 // Cache the flag on a static so that we can modify the value looked up below
1850 // in the presence of read-only flags.
1851 static bool abort_on_uncaught_exception =
1852 v8_flags.abort_on_uncaught_exception;
1853 if (abort_on_uncaught_exception) {
1854 CatchType prediction = PredictExceptionCatcher();
1855 if ((prediction == NOT_CAUGHT || prediction == CAUGHT_BY_EXTERNAL) &&
1856 (!abort_on_uncaught_exception_callback_ ||
1857 abort_on_uncaught_exception_callback_(
1858 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this)))) {
1859 // Prevent endless recursion.
1860 abort_on_uncaught_exception = false;
1861 // This flag is intended for use by JavaScript developers, so
1862 // print a user-friendly stack trace (not an internal one).
1863 PrintF(stderr, "%s\n\nFROM\n",
1864 MessageHandler::GetLocalizedMessage(this, message_obj).get());
1865 std::ostringstream stack_trace_stream;
1866 PrintCurrentStackTrace(stack_trace_stream);
1867 PrintF(stderr, "%s", stack_trace_stream.str().c_str());
1868 base::OS::Abort();
1869 }
1870 }
1871
1872 return message_obj;
1873}
1874
1875Tagged<Object> Isolate::Throw(Tagged<Object> raw_exception,
1876 MessageLocation* location) {
1877 DCHECK(!has_exception());
1878 IF_WASM(DCHECK_IMPLIES, trap_handler::IsTrapHandlerEnabled(),
1879 !trap_handler::IsThreadInWasm());
1880
1881 HandleScope scope(this);
1882 Handle<Object> exception(raw_exception, this);
1883
1884 if (v8_flags.print_all_exceptions) {
1885 PrintF("=========================================================\n");
1886 PrintF("Exception thrown:\n");
1887 if (location) {
1888 Handle<Script> script = location->script();
1889 Handle<Object> name(script->GetNameOrSourceURL(), this);
1890 PrintF("at ");
1891 if (IsString(*name) && String::cast(*name)->length() > 0)
1892 String::cast(*name)->PrintOn(stdout);
1893 else
1894 PrintF("<anonymous>");
1895// Script::GetLineNumber and Script::GetColumnNumber can allocate on the heap to
1896// initialize the line_ends array, so be careful when calling them.
1897#ifdef DEBUG
1898 if (AllowGarbageCollection::IsAllowed()) {
1899#else
1900 if ((false)) {
1901#endif
1902 Script::PositionInfo start_pos;
1903 Script::PositionInfo end_pos;
1904 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, location->start_pos(), &start_pos);
1905 Script::GetPositionInfo(script, location->end_pos(), &end_pos);
1906 PrintF(", %d:%d - %d:%d\n", start_pos.line + 1, start_pos.column + 1,
1907 end_pos.line + 1, end_pos.column + 1);
1908 // Make sure to update the raw exception pointer in case it moved.
1909 raw_exception = *exception;
1910 } else {
1911 PrintF(", line %d\n", script->GetLineNumber(location->start_pos()) + 1);
1912 }
1913 }
1914 Print(raw_exception);
1915 PrintF("Stack Trace:\n");
1916 PrintStack(stdout);
1917 PrintF("=========================================================\n");
1918 }
1919
1920 // Determine whether a message needs to be created for the given exception
1921 // depending on the following criteria:
1922 // 1) External v8::TryCatch missing: Always create a message because any
1923 // JavaScript handler for a finally-block might re-throw to top-level.
1924 // 2) External v8::TryCatch exists: Only create a message if the handler
1925 // captures messages or is verbose (which reports despite the catch).
1926 // 3) ReThrow from v8::TryCatch: The message from a previous throw still
1927 // exists and we preserve it instead of creating a new message.
1928 bool requires_message = try_catch_handler() == nullptr ||
1929 try_catch_handler()->is_verbose_ ||
1930 try_catch_handler()->capture_message_;
1931 bool rethrowing_message = thread_local_top()->rethrowing_message_;
1932
1933 thread_local_top()->rethrowing_message_ = false;
1934
1935 // Notify debugger of exception.
1936 if (is_catchable_by_javascript(raw_exception)) {
1937 base::Optional<Tagged<Object>> maybe_exception =
1938 debug()->OnThrow(exception);
1939 if (maybe_exception.has_value()) {
1940 return *maybe_exception;
1941 }
1942 }
1943
1944 // Generate the message if required.
1945 if (requires_message && !rethrowing_message) {
1946 MessageLocation computed_location;
1947 // If no location was specified we try to use a computed one instead.
1948 if (location == nullptr && ComputeLocation(&computed_location)) {
1949 location = &computed_location;
1950 }
1951 if (bootstrapper()->IsActive()) {
1952 // It's not safe to try to make message objects or collect stack traces
1953 // while the bootstrapper is active since the infrastructure may not have
1954 // been properly initialized.
1955 ReportBootstrappingException(exception, location);
1956 } else {
1957 Handle<Object> message_obj = CreateMessageOrAbort(exception, location);
1958 set_pending_message(*message_obj);
1959 }
1960 }
1961
1962 // Set the exception being thrown.
1963 set_exception(*exception);
1964 PropagateExceptionToExternalTryCatch(TopExceptionHandlerType(*exception));
1965 return ReadOnlyRoots(heap()).exception();
1966}
1967
1968Tagged<Object> Isolate::ReThrow(Tagged<Object> exception) {
1969 DCHECK(!has_exception());
1970
1971 // Set the exception being re-thrown.
1972 set_exception(exception);
1973 return ReadOnlyRoots(heap()).exception();
1974}
1975
1976Tagged<Object> Isolate::ReThrow(Tagged<Object> exception,
1977 Tagged<Object> message) {
1978 DCHECK(!has_exception());
1979 DCHECK(!has_pending_message());
1980
1981 set_pending_message(message);
1982 return ReThrow(exception);
1983}
1984
1985namespace {
1986#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
1987// This scope will set the thread-in-wasm flag after the execution of all
1988// destructors. The thread-in-wasm flag is only set when the scope gets enabled.
1989class SetThreadInWasmFlagScope {
1990 public:
1991 SetThreadInWasmFlagScope() {
1992 DCHECK_IMPLIES(trap_handler::IsTrapHandlerEnabled(),
1993 !trap_handler::IsThreadInWasm());
1994 }
1995
1996 ~SetThreadInWasmFlagScope() {
1997 if (enabled_) trap_handler::SetThreadInWasm();
1998 }
1999
2000 void Enable() { enabled_ = true; }
2001
2002 private:
2003 bool enabled_ = false;
2004};
2005#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2006} // namespace
2007
2008Tagged<Object> Isolate::UnwindAndFindHandler() {
2009 // TODO(v8:12676): Fix gcmole failures in this function.
2010 DisableGCMole no_gcmole;
2011 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
2012
2013 // The topmost_script_having_context value becomes outdated after frames
2014 // unwinding.
2015 clear_topmost_script_having_context();
2016
2017#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2018 // Create the {SetThreadInWasmFlagScope} first in this function so that its
2019 // destructor gets called after all the other destructors. It is important
2020 // that the destructor sets the thread-in-wasm flag after all other
2021 // destructors. The other destructors may cause exceptions, e.g. ASan on
2022 // Windows, which would invalidate the thread-in-wasm flag when the wasm trap
2023 // handler handles such non-wasm exceptions.
2024 SetThreadInWasmFlagScope set_thread_in_wasm_flag_scope;
2025#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2026 Tagged<Object> exception = this->exception();
2027
2028 auto FoundHandler = [&](Tagged<Context> context, Address instruction_start,
2029 intptr_t handler_offset,
2030 Address constant_pool_address, Address handler_sp,
2031 Address handler_fp, int num_frames_above_handler) {
2032 // Store information to be consumed by the CEntry.
2033 thread_local_top()->pending_handler_context_ = context;
2034 thread_local_top()->pending_handler_entrypoint_ =
2035 instruction_start + handler_offset;
2036 thread_local_top()->pending_handler_constant_pool_ = constant_pool_address;
2037 thread_local_top()->pending_handler_fp_ = handler_fp;
2038 thread_local_top()->pending_handler_sp_ = handler_sp;
2039 thread_local_top()->num_frames_above_pending_handler_ =
2040 num_frames_above_handler;
2041
2042 // Return and clear exception. The contract is that:
2043 // (1) the exception is stored in one place (no duplication), and
2044 // (2) within generated-code land, that one place is the return register.
2045 // If/when we unwind back into C++ (returning to the JSEntry stub,
2046 // or to Execution::CallWasm), the returned exception will be sent
2047 // back to isolate->set_exception(...).
2048 clear_internal_exception();
2049 return exception;
2050 };
2051
2052 // Special handling of termination exceptions, uncatchable by JavaScript and
2053 // Wasm code, we unwind the handlers until the top ENTRY handler is found.
2054 bool catchable_by_js = is_catchable_by_javascript(exception);
2055 if (!catchable_by_js && !context().is_null()) {
2056 // Because the array join stack will not pop the elements when throwing the
2057 // uncatchable terminate exception, we need to clear the array join stack to
2058 // avoid leaving the stack in an invalid state.
2059 // See also CycleProtectedArrayJoin.
2060 raw_native_context()->set_array_join_stack(
2061 ReadOnlyRoots(this).undefined_value());
2062 }
2063
2064 // Compute handler and stack unwinding information by performing a full walk
2065 // over the stack and dispatching according to the frame type.
2066 int visited_frames = 0;
2067 for (StackFrameIterator iter(this);; iter.Advance(), visited_frames++) {
2068#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2069 if (iter.frame()->type() == StackFrame::STACK_SWITCH) {
2070 Tagged<Code> code =
2071 builtins()->code(Builtin::kWasmReturnPromiseOnSuspendAsm);
2072 HandlerTable table(code);
2073 Address instruction_start =
2074 code->InstructionStart(this, iter.frame()->pc());
2075 int handler_offset = table.LookupReturn(0);
2076 return FoundHandler(Context(), instruction_start, handler_offset,
2077 kNullAddress, iter.frame()->sp(), iter.frame()->fp(),
2078 visited_frames);
2079 }
2080#endif
2081 // Handler must exist.
2082 DCHECK(!iter.done());
2083
2084 StackFrame* frame = iter.frame();
2085
2086 // The debugger implements the "restart frame" feature by throwing a
2087 // terminate exception. Check and if we need to restart `frame`,
2088 // jump into the `RestartFrameTrampoline` builtin instead of
2089 // a catch handler.
2090 // Optimized frames take a detour via the deoptimizer before also jumping
2091 // to the `RestartFrameTrampoline` builtin.
2092 if (debug()->ShouldRestartFrame(frame->id())) {
2093 CancelTerminateExecution();
2094 CHECK(!catchable_by_js);
2095 CHECK(frame->is_java_script());
2096
2097 if (frame->is_optimized()) {
2098 Tagged<Code> code = frame->LookupCode();
2099 // The debugger triggers lazy deopt for the "to-be-restarted" frame
2100 // immediately when the CDP event arrives while paused.
2101 CHECK(code->marked_for_deoptimization());
2102 set_deoptimizer_lazy_throw(true);
2103
2104 // Jump directly to the optimized frames return, to immediately fall
2105 // into the deoptimizer.
2106 const int offset =
2107 static_cast<int>(frame->pc() - code->instruction_start());
2108
2109 // Compute the stack pointer from the frame pointer. This ensures that
2110 // argument slots on the stack are dropped as returning would.
2111 // Note: Needed by the deoptimizer to rematerialize frames.
2112 Address return_sp = frame->fp() +
2113 StandardFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeAboveFp -
2114 code->stack_slots() * kSystemPointerSize;
2115 return FoundHandler(Context(), code->instruction_start(), offset,
2116 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(),
2117 visited_frames);
2118 }
2119
2120 debug()->clear_restart_frame();
2121 Tagged<Code> code = *BUILTIN_CODE(this, RestartFrameTrampoline);
2122 return FoundHandler(Context(), code->instruction_start(), 0,
2123 code->constant_pool(), kNullAddress, frame->fp(),
2124 visited_frames);
2125 }
2126
2127 switch (frame->type()) {
2128 case StackFrame::ENTRY:
2129 case StackFrame::CONSTRUCT_ENTRY: {
2130 // For JSEntry frames we always have a handler.
2131 StackHandler* handler = frame->top_handler();
2132
2133 // Restore the next handler.
2134 thread_local_top()->handler_ = handler->next_address();
2135
2136 // Gather information from the handler.
2137 Tagged<Code> code = frame->LookupCode();
2138 HandlerTable table(code);
2139 return FoundHandler(Context(),
2140 code->InstructionStart(this, frame->pc()),
2141 table.LookupReturn(0), code->constant_pool(),
2142 handler->address() + StackHandlerConstants::kSize,
2143 0, visited_frames);
2144 }
2145
2146#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2147 case StackFrame::C_WASM_ENTRY: {
2148 StackHandler* handler = frame->top_handler();
2149 thread_local_top()->handler_ = handler->next_address();
2150 Tagged<Code> code = frame->LookupCode();
2151 HandlerTable table(code);
2152 Address instruction_start = code->instruction_start();
2153 int return_offset = static_cast<int>(frame->pc() - instruction_start);
2154 int handler_offset = table.LookupReturn(return_offset);
2155 DCHECK_NE(-1, handler_offset);
2156 // Compute the stack pointer from the frame pointer. This ensures that
2157 // argument slots on the stack are dropped as returning would.
2158 Address return_sp = frame->fp() +
2159 StandardFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeAboveFp -
2160 code->stack_slots() * kSystemPointerSize;
2161 return FoundHandler(Context(), instruction_start, handler_offset,
2162 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(),
2163 visited_frames);
2164 }
2165
2166 case StackFrame::WASM: {
2167 if (!is_catchable_by_wasm(exception)) break;
2168
2169 WasmFrame* wasm_frame = static_cast<WasmFrame*>(frame);
2170 wasm::WasmCode* wasm_code =
2171 wasm::GetWasmCodeManager()->LookupCode(this, frame->pc());
2172 int offset = wasm_frame->LookupExceptionHandlerInTable();
2173 if (offset < 0) break;
2174 // Compute the stack pointer from the frame pointer. This ensures that
2175 // argument slots on the stack are dropped as returning would.
2176 // The stack slot count needs to be adjusted for Liftoff frames. It has
2177 // two components: the fixed frame slots, and the maximum number of
2178 // registers pushed on top of the frame in out-of-line code. We know
2179 // that we are not currently in an OOL call, because OOL calls don't
2180 // have exception handlers. So we subtract the OOL spill count from the
2181 // total stack slot count to compute the actual frame size:
2182 int stack_slots = wasm_code->stack_slots() - wasm_code->ool_spills();
2183 Address return_sp = frame->fp() +
2184 StandardFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeAboveFp -
2185 stack_slots * kSystemPointerSize;
2186
2187 // This is going to be handled by WebAssembly, so we need to set the TLS
2188 // flag. The {SetThreadInWasmFlagScope} will set the flag after all
2189 // destructors have been executed.
2190 set_thread_in_wasm_flag_scope.Enable();
2191 return FoundHandler(Context(), wasm_code->instruction_start(), offset,
2192 wasm_code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(),
2193 visited_frames);
2194 }
2195
2196 case StackFrame::WASM_LIFTOFF_SETUP: {
2197 // The WasmLiftoffFrameSetup builtin doesn't throw, and doesn't call
2198 // out to user code that could throw.
2199 UNREACHABLE();
2200 }
2201 case StackFrame::WASM_TO_JS: {
2202 Tagged<Object> suspender_obj = root(RootIndex::kActiveSuspender);
2203 if (!IsUndefined(suspender_obj)) {
2204 Tagged<WasmSuspenderObject> suspender =
2205 WasmSuspenderObject::cast(suspender_obj);
2206 // If the wasm-to-js wrapper was on a secondary stack and switched
2207 // to the central stack, handle the implicit switch back.
2208 Address central_stack_sp = *reinterpret_cast<Address*>(
2209 frame->fp() +
2210 WasmImportWrapperFrameConstants::kCentralStackSPOffset);
2211 bool switched_stacks = central_stack_sp != kNullAddress;
2212 if (switched_stacks) {
2213 DCHECK_EQ(1, suspender->has_js_frames());
2214 suspender->set_has_js_frames(0);
2215 thread_local_top()->is_on_central_stack_flag_ = false;
2216 Address secondary_stack_limit = Memory<Address>(
2217 frame->fp() +
2218 WasmImportWrapperFrameConstants::kSecondaryStackLimitOffset);
2219 stack_guard()->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(
2220 secondary_stack_limit);
2221 }
2222 }
2223 break;
2224 }
2225#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2226
2227 case StackFrame::MAGLEV:
2228 case StackFrame::TURBOFAN: {
2229 // For optimized frames we perform a lookup in the handler table.
2230 if (!catchable_by_js) break;
2231 OptimizedFrame* opt_frame = static_cast<OptimizedFrame*>(frame);
2232 int offset = opt_frame->LookupExceptionHandlerInTable(nullptr, nullptr);
2233 if (offset < 0) break;
2234 // The code might be an optimized code or a turbofanned builtin.
2235 Tagged<Code> code = frame->LookupCode();
2236 // Compute the stack pointer from the frame pointer. This ensures
2237 // that argument slots on the stack are dropped as returning would.
2238 Address return_sp = frame->fp() +
2239 StandardFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeAboveFp -
2240 code->stack_slots() * kSystemPointerSize;
2241
2242 // TODO(bmeurer): Turbofanned BUILTIN frames appear as TURBOFAN,
2243 // but do not have a code kind of TURBOFAN.
2244 if (CodeKindCanDeoptimize(code->kind()) &&
2245 code->marked_for_deoptimization()) {
2246 // If the target code is lazy deoptimized, we jump to the original
2247 // return address, but we make a note that we are throwing, so
2248 // that the deoptimizer can do the right thing.
2249 offset = static_cast<int>(frame->pc() - code->instruction_start());
2250 set_deoptimizer_lazy_throw(true);
2251 }
2252
2253 return FoundHandler(
2254 Context(), code->InstructionStart(this, frame->pc()), offset,
2255 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(), visited_frames);
2256 }
2257
2258 case StackFrame::STUB: {
2259 // Some stubs are able to handle exceptions.
2260 if (!catchable_by_js) break;
2261 StubFrame* stub_frame = static_cast<StubFrame*>(frame);
2262#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2263#if DEBUG
2264 DCHECK_NULL(wasm::GetWasmCodeManager()->LookupCode(this, frame->pc()));
2265#endif
2266 {
2267 Tagged<Code> code = stub_frame->LookupCode();
2268 if (code->builtin_id() == Builtin::kWasmToJsWrapperCSA) {
2269 // If the wasm-to-js wrapper was on a secondary stack and switched
2270 // to the central stack, handle the implicit switch back.
2271 Address central_stack_sp = *reinterpret_cast<Address*>(
2272 frame->fp() + WasmToJSWrapperConstants::kCentralStackSPOffset);
2273 bool switched_stacks = central_stack_sp != kNullAddress;
2274 if (switched_stacks) {
2275 thread_local_top()->is_on_central_stack_flag_ = false;
2276 Address secondary_stack_limit = Memory<Address>(
2277 frame->fp() +
2278 WasmToJSWrapperConstants::kSecondaryStackLimitOffset);
2279 stack_guard()->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(
2280 secondary_stack_limit);
2281 }
2282 }
2283 }
2284#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2285
2286 // The code might be a dynamically generated stub or a turbofanned
2287 // embedded builtin.
2288 Tagged<Code> code = stub_frame->LookupCode();
2289 if (!code->is_turbofanned() || !code->has_handler_table()) {
2290 break;
2291 }
2292
2293 int offset = stub_frame->LookupExceptionHandlerInTable();
2294 if (offset < 0) break;
2295
2296 // Compute the stack pointer from the frame pointer. This ensures
2297 // that argument slots on the stack are dropped as returning would.
2298 Address return_sp = frame->fp() +
2299 StandardFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeAboveFp -
2300 code->stack_slots() * kSystemPointerSize;
2301
2302 return FoundHandler(
2303 Context(), code->InstructionStart(this, frame->pc()), offset,
2304 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(), visited_frames);
2305 }
2306
2307 case StackFrame::INTERPRETED:
2308 case StackFrame::BASELINE: {
2309 // For interpreted frame we perform a range lookup in the handler table.
2310 if (!catchable_by_js) break;
2311 UnoptimizedFrame* js_frame = UnoptimizedFrame::cast(frame);
2312 int register_slots = UnoptimizedFrameConstants::RegisterStackSlotCount(
2313 js_frame->GetBytecodeArray()->register_count());
2314 int context_reg = 0; // Will contain register index holding context.
2315 int offset =
2316 js_frame->LookupExceptionHandlerInTable(&context_reg, nullptr);
2317 if (offset < 0) break;
2318 // Compute the stack pointer from the frame pointer. This ensures that
2319 // argument slots on the stack are dropped as returning would.
2320 // Note: This is only needed for interpreted frames that have been
2321 // materialized by the deoptimizer. If there is a handler frame
2322 // in between then {frame->sp()} would already be correct.
2323 Address return_sp = frame->fp() -
2324 InterpreterFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeFromFp -
2325 register_slots * kSystemPointerSize;
2326
2327 // Patch the bytecode offset in the interpreted frame to reflect the
2328 // position of the exception handler. The special builtin below will
2329 // take care of continuing to dispatch at that position. Also restore
2330 // the correct context for the handler from the interpreter register.
2331 Tagged<Context> context =
2332 Context::cast(js_frame->ReadInterpreterRegister(context_reg));
2333 DCHECK(IsContext(context));
2334
2335 if (frame->is_baseline()) {
2336 BaselineFrame* sp_frame = BaselineFrame::cast(js_frame);
2337 Tagged<Code> code = sp_frame->LookupCode();
2338 intptr_t pc_offset = sp_frame->GetPCForBytecodeOffset(offset);
2339 // Patch the context register directly on the frame, so that we don't
2340 // need to have a context read + write in the baseline code.
2341 sp_frame->PatchContext(context);
2342 return FoundHandler(Context(), code->instruction_start(), pc_offset,
2343 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, sp_frame->fp(),
2344 visited_frames);
2345 } else {
2346 InterpretedFrame::cast(js_frame)->PatchBytecodeOffset(
2347 static_cast<int>(offset));
2348
2349 Tagged<Code> code = *BUILTIN_CODE(this, InterpreterEnterAtBytecode);
2350 // We subtract a frame from visited_frames because otherwise the
2351 // shadow stack will drop the underlying interpreter entry trampoline
2352 // in which the handler runs.
2353 //
2354 // An interpreted frame cannot be the first frame we look at
2355 // because at a minimum, an exit frame into C++ has to separate
2356 // it and the context in which this C++ code runs.
2357 CHECK_GE(visited_frames, 1);
2358 return FoundHandler(context, code->instruction_start(), 0,
2359 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(),
2360 visited_frames - 1);
2361 }
2362 }
2363
2364 case StackFrame::BUILTIN:
2365 // For builtin frames we are guaranteed not to find a handler.
2366 if (catchable_by_js) {
2367 CHECK_EQ(-1, BuiltinFrame::cast(frame)->LookupExceptionHandlerInTable(
2368 nullptr, nullptr));
2369 }
2370 break;
2371
2372 case StackFrame::JAVA_SCRIPT_BUILTIN_CONTINUATION_WITH_CATCH: {
2373 // Builtin continuation frames with catch can handle exceptions.
2374 if (!catchable_by_js) break;
2375 JavaScriptBuiltinContinuationWithCatchFrame* js_frame =
2376 JavaScriptBuiltinContinuationWithCatchFrame::cast(frame);
2377 js_frame->SetException(exception);
2378
2379 // Reconstruct the stack pointer from the frame pointer.
2380 Address return_sp = js_frame->fp() - js_frame->GetSPToFPDelta();
2381 Tagged<Code> code = js_frame->LookupCode();
2382 return FoundHandler(Context(), code->instruction_start(), 0,
2383 code->constant_pool(), return_sp, frame->fp(),
2384 visited_frames);
2385 }
2386
2387 default:
2388 // All other types can not handle exception.
2389 break;
2390 }
2391
2392 if (frame->is_turbofan()) {
2393 // Remove per-frame stored materialized objects.
2394 bool removed = materialized_object_store_->Remove(frame->fp());
2395 USE(removed);
2396 // If there were any materialized objects, the code should be
2397 // marked for deopt.
2398 DCHECK_IMPLIES(removed, frame->LookupCode()->marked_for_deoptimization());
2399 }
2400 }
2401
2402 UNREACHABLE();
2403} // namespace internal
2404
2405namespace {
2406
2407class StackFrameSummaryIterator {
2408 public:
2409 explicit StackFrameSummaryIterator(Isolate* isolate)
2410 : stack_iterator_(isolate), summaries_(), index_(0) {
2411 InitSummaries();
2412 }
2413 void Advance() {
2414 if (index_ == 0) {
2415 summaries_.clear();
2416 stack_iterator_.Advance();
2417 InitSummaries();
2418 } else {
2419 index_--;
2420 }
2421 }
2422 bool done() const { return stack_iterator_.done(); }
2423 StackFrame* frame() const { return stack_iterator_.frame(); }
2424 bool has_frame_summary() const { return index_ < summaries_.size(); }
2425 const FrameSummary& frame_summary() const {
2426 DCHECK(has_frame_summary());
2427 return summaries_[index_];
2428 }
2429 Isolate* isolate() const { return stack_iterator_.isolate(); }
2430
2431 private:
2432 void InitSummaries() {
2433 if (!done() && frame()->is_java_script()) {
2434 JavaScriptFrame::cast(frame())->Summarize(&summaries_);
2435 DCHECK_GT(summaries_.size(), 0);
2436 index_ = summaries_.size() - 1;
2437 }
2438 }
2439 StackFrameIterator stack_iterator_;
2440 std::vector<FrameSummary> summaries_;
2441 size_t index_;
2442};
2443
2444HandlerTable::CatchPrediction CatchPredictionFor(Builtin builtin_id) {
2445 switch (builtin_id) {
2446#define CASE(Name) \
2447 case Builtin::k##Name: \
2448 return HandlerTable::PROMISE;
2449 BUILTIN_PROMISE_REJECTION_PREDICTION_LIST(CASE)
2450#undef CASE
2451 default:
2452 return HandlerTable::UNCAUGHT;
2453 }
2454}
2455
2456HandlerTable::CatchPrediction PredictExceptionFromBytecode(
2457 Tagged<BytecodeArray> bytecode, int code_offset) {
2458 HandlerTable table(bytecode);
2459 int handler_index = table.LookupHandlerIndexForRange(code_offset);
2460 if (handler_index < 0) return HandlerTable::UNCAUGHT;
2461 return table.GetRangePrediction(handler_index);
2462}
2463
2464HandlerTable::CatchPrediction PredictException(const FrameSummary& summary,
2465 Isolate* isolate) {
2466 PtrComprCageBase cage_base(isolate);
2467 Handle<AbstractCode> code = summary.AsJavaScript().abstract_code();
2468 if (code->kind(cage_base) == CodeKind::BUILTIN) {
2469 return CatchPredictionFor(code->GetCode()->builtin_id());
2470 }
2471
2472 // Must have been constructed from a bytecode array.
2473 CHECK_EQ(CodeKind::INTERPRETED_FUNCTION, code->kind(cage_base));
2474 return PredictExceptionFromBytecode(code->GetBytecodeArray(),
2475 summary.code_offset());
2476}
2477
2478HandlerTable::CatchPrediction PredictExceptionFromGenerator(
2479 Handle<JSGeneratorObject> generator, Isolate* isolate) {
2480 return PredictExceptionFromBytecode(
2481 generator->function()->shared()->GetBytecodeArray(isolate),
2482 GetGeneratorBytecodeOffset(generator));
2483}
2484
2485Isolate::CatchType ToCatchType(HandlerTable::CatchPrediction prediction) {
2486 switch (prediction) {
2487 case HandlerTable::UNCAUGHT:
2488 return Isolate::NOT_CAUGHT;
2489 case HandlerTable::CAUGHT:
2490 return Isolate::CAUGHT_BY_JAVASCRIPT;
2491 case HandlerTable::PROMISE:
2492 return Isolate::CAUGHT_BY_PROMISE;
2493 case HandlerTable::UNCAUGHT_ASYNC_AWAIT:
2494 case HandlerTable::ASYNC_AWAIT:
2495 return Isolate::CAUGHT_BY_ASYNC_AWAIT;
2496 default:
2497 UNREACHABLE();
2498 }
2499}
2500
2501Isolate::CatchType PredictExceptionCatchAtFrame(
2502 const StackFrameSummaryIterator& iterator) {
2503 const StackFrame* frame = iterator.frame();
2504 switch (frame->type()) {
2505 case StackFrame::ENTRY:
2506 case StackFrame::CONSTRUCT_ENTRY: {
2507 Address external_handler =
2508 iterator.isolate()->thread_local_top()->try_catch_handler_address();
2509 Address entry_handler = frame->top_handler()->next_address();
2510 // The exception has been externally caught if and only if there is an
2511 // external handler which is on top of the top-most JS_ENTRY handler.
2512 if (external_handler != kNullAddress &&
2513 !iterator.isolate()->try_catch_handler()->IsVerbose()) {
2514 if (entry_handler == kNullAddress || entry_handler > external_handler) {
2515 return Isolate::CAUGHT_BY_EXTERNAL;
2516 }
2517 }
2518 } break;
2519
2520 // For JavaScript frames we perform a lookup in the handler table.
2521 case StackFrame::INTERPRETED:
2522 case StackFrame::BASELINE:
2523 case StackFrame::TURBOFAN:
2524 case StackFrame::MAGLEV:
2525 case StackFrame::BUILTIN: {
2526 DCHECK(iterator.has_frame_summary());
2527 return ToCatchType(
2528 PredictException(iterator.frame_summary(), iterator.isolate()));
2529 }
2530
2531 case StackFrame::STUB: {
2532 Tagged<Code> code = *frame->LookupCode();
2533 if (code->kind() != CodeKind::BUILTIN || !code->has_handler_table() ||
2534 !code->is_turbofanned()) {
2535 break;
2536 }
2537
2538 return ToCatchType(CatchPredictionFor(code->builtin_id()));
2539 }
2540
2541 case StackFrame::JAVA_SCRIPT_BUILTIN_CONTINUATION_WITH_CATCH: {
2542 Tagged<Code> code = *frame->LookupCode();
2543 return ToCatchType(CatchPredictionFor(code->builtin_id()));
2544 }
2545
2546 default:
2547 // All other types can not handle exception.
2548 break;
2549 }
2550 return Isolate::NOT_CAUGHT;
2551}
2552} // anonymous namespace
2553
2554Isolate::CatchType Isolate::PredictExceptionCatcher() {
2555 if (TopExceptionHandlerType(Tagged<Object>()) ==
2556 ExceptionHandlerType::kExternalTryCatch) {
2557 return CAUGHT_BY_EXTERNAL;
2558 }
2559
2560 // Search for an exception handler by performing a full walk over the stack.
2561 for (StackFrameSummaryIterator iter(this); !iter.done(); iter.Advance()) {
2562 Isolate::CatchType prediction = PredictExceptionCatchAtFrame(iter);
2563 if (prediction != NOT_CAUGHT) return prediction;
2564 }
2565
2566 // Handler not found.
2567 return NOT_CAUGHT;
2568}
2569
2570Tagged<Object> Isolate::ThrowIllegalOperation() {
2571 if (v8_flags.stack_trace_on_illegal) PrintStack(stdout);
2572 return Throw(ReadOnlyRoots(heap()).illegal_access_string());
2573}
2574
2575void Isolate::PrintCurrentStackTrace(std::ostream& out) {
2576 Handle<FixedArray> frames = CaptureSimpleStackTrace(
2577 this, FixedArray::kMaxLength, SKIP_NONE, factory()->undefined_value());
2578
2579 IncrementalStringBuilder builder(this);
2580 for (int i = 0; i < frames->length(); ++i) {
2581 Handle<CallSiteInfo> frame(CallSiteInfo::cast(frames->get(i)), this);
2582 SerializeCallSiteInfo(this, frame, &builder);
2583 if (i != frames->length() - 1) builder.AppendCharacter('\n');
2584 }
2585
2586 DirectHandle<String> stack_trace = builder.Finish().ToHandleChecked();
2587 stack_trace->PrintOn(out);
2588}
2589
2590bool Isolate::ComputeLocation(MessageLocation* target) {
2591 DebuggableStackFrameIterator it(this);
2592 if (it.done()) return false;
2593 // Compute the location from the function and the relocation info of the
2594 // baseline code. For optimized code this will use the deoptimization
2595 // information to get canonical location information.
2596#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2597 wasm::WasmCodeRefScope code_ref_scope;
2598#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
2599 FrameSummary summary = it.GetTopValidFrame();
2600 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> shared;
2601 Handle<Object> script = summary.script();
2602 if (!IsScript(*script) ||
2603 IsUndefined(Script::cast(*script)->source(), this)) {
2604 return false;
2605 }
2606
2607 if (summary.IsJavaScript()) {
2608 shared = handle(summary.AsJavaScript().function()->shared(), this);
2609 }
2610 if (summary.AreSourcePositionsAvailable()) {
2611 int pos = summary.SourcePosition();
2612 *target =
2613 MessageLocation(Handle<Script>::cast(script), pos, pos + 1, shared);
2614 } else {
2615 *target = MessageLocation(Handle<Script>::cast(script), shared,
2616 summary.code_offset());
2617 }
2618 return true;
2619}
2620
2621bool Isolate::ComputeLocationFromException(MessageLocation* target,
2622 Handle<Object> exception) {
2623 if (!IsJSObject(*exception)) return false;
2624
2625 Handle<Name> start_pos_symbol = factory()->error_start_pos_symbol();
2626 Handle<Object> start_pos = JSReceiver::GetDataProperty(
2627 this, Handle<JSObject>::cast(exception), start_pos_symbol);
2628 if (!IsSmi(*start_pos)) return false;
2629 int start_pos_value = Smi::cast(*start_pos).value();
2630
2631 Handle<Name> end_pos_symbol = factory()->error_end_pos_symbol();
2632 Handle<Object> end_pos = JSReceiver::GetDataProperty(
2633 this, Handle<JSObject>::cast(exception), end_pos_symbol);
2634 if (!IsSmi(*end_pos)) return false;
2635 int end_pos_value = Smi::cast(*end_pos).value();
2636
2637 Handle<Name> script_symbol = factory()->error_script_symbol();
2638 Handle<Object> script = JSReceiver::GetDataProperty(
2639 this, Handle<JSObject>::cast(exception), script_symbol);
2640 if (!IsScript(*script)) return false;
2641
2642 Handle<Script> cast_script(Script::cast(*script), this);
2643 *target = MessageLocation(cast_script, start_pos_value, end_pos_value);
2644 return true;
2645}
2646
2647bool Isolate::ComputeLocationFromSimpleStackTrace(MessageLocation* target,
2648 Handle<Object> exception) {
2649 if (!IsJSReceiver(*exception)) {
2650 return false;
2651 }
2652 Handle<FixedArray> call_site_infos =
2653 GetSimpleStackTrace(Handle<JSReceiver>::cast(exception));
2654 for (int i = 0; i < call_site_infos->length(); ++i) {
2655 Handle<CallSiteInfo> call_site_info(
2656 CallSiteInfo::cast(call_site_infos->get(i)), this);
2657 if (CallSiteInfo::ComputeLocation(call_site_info, target)) {
2658 return true;
2659 }
2660 }
2661 return false;
2662}
2663
2664bool Isolate::ComputeLocationFromDetailedStackTrace(MessageLocation* target,
2665 Handle<Object> exception) {
2666 if (!IsJSReceiver(*exception)) return false;
2667
2668 Handle<FixedArray> stack_frame_infos =
2669 GetDetailedStackTrace(Handle<JSReceiver>::cast(exception));
2670 if (stack_frame_infos.is_null() || stack_frame_infos->length() == 0) {
2671 return false;
2672 }
2673
2674 Handle<StackFrameInfo> info(StackFrameInfo::cast(stack_frame_infos->get(0)),
2675 this);
2676 const int pos = StackFrameInfo::GetSourcePosition(info);
2677 *target = MessageLocation(handle(info->script(), this), pos, pos + 1);
2678 return true;
2679}
2680
2681Handle<JSMessageObject> Isolate::CreateMessage(Handle<Object> exception,
2682 MessageLocation* location) {
2683 Handle<FixedArray> stack_trace_object;
2684 if (capture_stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_) {
2685 if (IsJSError(*exception)) {
2686 // We fetch the stack trace that corresponds to this error object.
2687 // If the lookup fails, the exception is probably not a valid Error
2688 // object. In that case, we fall through and capture the stack trace
2689 // at this throw site.
2690 stack_trace_object =
2691 GetDetailedStackTrace(Handle<JSObject>::cast(exception));
2692 }
2693 if (stack_trace_object.is_null()) {
2694 // Not an error object, we capture stack and location at throw site.
2695 stack_trace_object = CaptureDetailedStackTrace(
2696 stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_frame_limit_,
2697 stack_trace_for_uncaught_exceptions_options_);
2698 }
2699 }
2700 MessageLocation computed_location;
2701 if (location == nullptr &&
2702 (ComputeLocationFromException(&computed_location, exception) ||
2703 ComputeLocationFromSimpleStackTrace(&computed_location, exception) ||
2704 ComputeLocation(&computed_location))) {
2705 location = &computed_location;
2706 }
2707
2708 return MessageHandler::MakeMessageObject(
2709 this, MessageTemplate::kUncaughtException, location, exception,
2710 stack_trace_object);
2711}
2712
2713Handle<JSMessageObject> Isolate::CreateMessageFromException(
2714 Handle<Object> exception) {
2715 Handle<FixedArray> stack_trace_object;
2716 if (IsJSError(*exception)) {
2717 stack_trace_object =
2718 GetDetailedStackTrace(Handle<JSObject>::cast(exception));
2719 }
2720
2721 MessageLocation* location = nullptr;
2722 MessageLocation computed_location;
2723 if (ComputeLocationFromException(&computed_location, exception) ||
2724 ComputeLocationFromDetailedStackTrace(&computed_location, exception)) {
2725 location = &computed_location;
2726 }
2727
2728 return MessageHandler::MakeMessageObject(
2729 this, MessageTemplate::kPlaceholderOnly, location, exception,
2730 stack_trace_object);
2731}
2732
2733Isolate::ExceptionHandlerType Isolate::TopExceptionHandlerType(
2734 Tagged<Object> exception) {
2735 DCHECK_NE(ReadOnlyRoots(heap()).the_hole_value(), exception);
2736
2737 Address js_handler = Isolate::handler(thread_local_top());
2738 Address external_handler = thread_local_top()->try_catch_handler_address();
2739
2740 // A handler cannot be on top if it doesn't exist. For uncatchable exceptions,
2741 // the JavaScript handler cannot be on top.
2742 if (js_handler == kNullAddress || !is_catchable_by_javascript(exception)) {
2743 if (external_handler == kNullAddress) {
2744 return ExceptionHandlerType::kNone;
2745 }
2746 return ExceptionHandlerType::kExternalTryCatch;
2747 }
2748
2749 if (external_handler == kNullAddress) {
2750 return ExceptionHandlerType::kJavaScriptHandler;
2751 }
2752
2753 // The exception has been externally caught if and only if there is an
2754 // external handler which is on top of the top-most JS_ENTRY handler.
2755 //
2756 // Note, that finally clauses would re-throw an exception unless it's aborted
2757 // by jumps in control flow (like return, break, etc.) and we'll have another
2758 // chance to set proper v8::TryCatch later.
2759 DCHECK_NE(kNullAddress, external_handler);
2760 DCHECK_NE(kNullAddress, js_handler);
2761 if (external_handler < js_handler) {
2762 return ExceptionHandlerType::kExternalTryCatch;
2763 }
2764 return ExceptionHandlerType::kJavaScriptHandler;
2765}
2766
2767std::vector<MemoryRange>* Isolate::GetCodePages() const {
2768 return code_pages_.load(std::memory_order_acquire);
2769}
2770
2771void Isolate::SetCodePages(std::vector<MemoryRange>* new_code_pages) {
2772 code_pages_.store(new_code_pages, std::memory_order_release);
2773}
2774
2775void Isolate::ReportPendingMessages(bool report) {
2776 Tagged<Object> exception_obj = exception();
2777 ExceptionHandlerType top_handler = TopExceptionHandlerType(exception_obj);
2778
2779 // Try to propagate the exception to an external v8::TryCatch handler. If
2780 // propagation was unsuccessful, then we will get another chance at reporting
2781 // the pending message if the exception is re-thrown.
2782 bool has_been_propagated = PropagateExceptionToExternalTryCatch(top_handler);
2783 if (!has_been_propagated) return;
2784 if (!report) return;
2785
2786 DCHECK(AllowExceptions::IsAllowed(this));
2787
2788 // The embedder might run script in response to an exception.
2789 AllowJavascriptExecutionDebugOnly allow_script(this);
2790
2791 // Clear the pending message object early to avoid endless recursion.
2792 Tagged<Object> message_obj = pending_message();
2793 clear_pending_message();
2794
2795 // For uncatchable exceptions we do nothing. If needed, the exception and the
2796 // message have already been propagated to v8::TryCatch.
2797 if (!is_catchable_by_javascript(exception_obj)) return;
2798
2799 // Determine whether the message needs to be reported to all message handlers
2800 // depending on whether the topmost external v8::TryCatch is verbose. We know
2801 // there's no JavaScript handler on top; if there was, we would've returned
2802 // early.
2803 DCHECK_NE(ExceptionHandlerType::kJavaScriptHandler, top_handler);
2804
2805 bool should_report_exception;
2806 if (top_handler == ExceptionHandlerType::kExternalTryCatch) {
2807 should_report_exception = try_catch_handler()->is_verbose_;
2808 } else {
2809 should_report_exception = true;
2810 }
2811
2812 // Actually report the pending message to all message handlers.
2813 if (!IsTheHole(message_obj, this) && should_report_exception) {
2814 HandleScope scope(this);
2815 Handle<JSMessageObject> message(JSMessageObject::cast(message_obj), this);
2816 Handle<Script> script(message->script(), this);
2817 // Clear the exception and restore it afterwards, otherwise
2818 // CollectSourcePositions will abort.
2819 {
2820 ExceptionScope exception_scope(this);
2821 JSMessageObject::EnsureSourcePositionsAvailable(this, message);
2822 }
2823 int start_pos = message->GetStartPosition();
2824 int end_pos = message->GetEndPosition();
2825 MessageLocation location(script, start_pos, end_pos);
2826 MessageHandler::ReportMessage(this, &location, message);
2827 }
2828}
2829
2830namespace {
2831bool ReceiverIsForwardingHandler(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSReceiver> handler) {
2832 // Recurse to the forwarding Promise (e.g. return false) due to
2833 // - await reaction forwarding to the throwaway Promise, which has
2834 // a dependency edge to the outer Promise.
2835 // - PromiseIdResolveHandler forwarding to the output of .then
2836 // - Promise.all/Promise.race forwarding to a throwaway Promise, which
2837 // has a dependency edge to the generated outer Promise.
2838 // Otherwise, this is a real reject handler for the Promise.
2839 Handle<Symbol> key = isolate->factory()->promise_forwarding_handler_symbol();
2840 Handle<Object> forwarding_handler =
2841 JSReceiver::GetDataProperty(isolate, handler, key);
2842 return !IsUndefined(*forwarding_handler, isolate);
2843}
2844
2845bool WalkPromiseTreeInternal(
2846 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSPromise> promise,
2847 const std::function<void(Isolate::PromiseHandler)>& callback) {
2848 if (promise->status() != Promise::kPending) {
2849 // If a rejection reaches an exception that isn't pending, it will be
2850 // treated as caught.
2851 return true;
2852 }
2853
2854 bool any_caught = false;
2855 bool any_uncaught = false;
2856 Handle<Object> current(promise->reactions(), isolate);
2857 while (!IsSmi(*current)) {
2858 Handle<PromiseReaction> reaction = Handle<PromiseReaction>::cast(current);
2859 Handle<HeapObject> promise_or_capability(reaction->promise_or_capability(),
2860 isolate);
2861 if (!IsUndefined(*promise_or_capability, isolate)) {
2862 if (!IsJSPromise(*promise_or_capability)) {
2863 promise_or_capability = handle(
2864 Handle<PromiseCapability>::cast(promise_or_capability)->promise(),
2865 isolate);
2866 }
2867 if (IsJSPromise(*promise_or_capability)) {
2868 Handle<JSPromise> next_promise =
2869 Handle<JSPromise>::cast(promise_or_capability);
2870 bool caught = false;
2871 Handle<JSReceiver> reject_handler;
2872 if (!IsUndefined(reaction->reject_handler(), isolate)) {
2873 reject_handler =
2874 handle(JSReceiver::cast(reaction->reject_handler()), isolate);
2875 if (!ReceiverIsForwardingHandler(isolate, reject_handler) &&
2876 !IsBuiltinForwardingRejectHandler(isolate, *reject_handler)) {
2877 caught = true;
2878 }
2879 }
2880 // Pass each handler to the callback
2881 Handle<JSGeneratorObject> async_function;
2882 if (TryGetAsyncGenerator(isolate, reaction).ToHandle(&async_function)) {
2883 caught = caught ||
2884 PredictExceptionFromGenerator(async_function, isolate) ==
2885 HandlerTable::CAUGHT;
2886 // Look at the async function, not the individual handlers
2887 callback({async_function->function()->shared(), true});
2888 } else {
2889 // Not an async function, look at individual handlers
2890 if (!IsUndefined(reaction->fulfill_handler(), isolate)) {
2891 Handle<JSReceiver> fulfill_handler(
2892 JSReceiver::cast(reaction->fulfill_handler()), isolate);
2893 if (!ReceiverIsForwardingHandler(isolate, fulfill_handler)) {
2894 if (IsBuiltinFunction(isolate, *fulfill_handler,
2895 Builtin::kPromiseThenFinally)) {
2896 // If this is the finally handler, get the wrapped callback
2897 // from the context to use instead
2898 Handle<Context> context(
2899 JSFunction::cast(reaction->fulfill_handler())->context(),
2900 isolate);
2901 int const index =
2902 PromiseBuiltins::PromiseFinallyContextSlot::kOnFinallySlot;
2903 fulfill_handler =
2904 handle(JSReceiver::cast(context->get(index)), isolate);
2905 }
2906 if (IsJSFunction(*fulfill_handler)) {
2907 callback({Handle<JSFunction>::cast(fulfill_handler)->shared(),
2908 true});
2909 }
2910 }
2911 }
2912 if (caught) {
2913 // We've already checked that this isn't undefined or
2914 // a forwarding handler
2915 if (IsJSFunction(*reject_handler)) {
2916 callback(
2917 {Handle<JSFunction>::cast(reject_handler)->shared(), true});
2918 }
2919 }
2920 }
2921 caught =
2922 caught || WalkPromiseTreeInternal(isolate, next_promise, callback);
2923 any_caught = any_caught || caught;
2924 any_uncaught = any_uncaught || !caught;
2925 }
2926 }
2927 current = handle(reaction->next(), isolate);
2928 }
2929
2930 bool caught = any_caught && !any_uncaught;
2931
2932 if (!caught) {
2933 // If there is an outer promise, follow that to see if it is caught.
2934 Handle<Symbol> key = isolate->factory()->promise_handled_by_symbol();
2935 Handle<Object> outer_promise_obj =
2936 JSObject::GetDataProperty(isolate, promise, key);
2937 if (IsJSPromise(*outer_promise_obj)) {
2938 return WalkPromiseTreeInternal(
2939 isolate, Handle<JSPromise>::cast(outer_promise_obj), callback);
2940 }
2941 }
2942 return caught;
2943}
2944
2945// Helper functions to scan for calls to .catch.
2946using interpreter::Bytecode;
2947using interpreter::Bytecodes;
2948
2949enum PromiseMethod { kThen, kCatch, kFinally, kInvalid };
2950
2951// Requires the iterator to be on a GetNamedProperty instruction
2952PromiseMethod GetPromiseMethod(
2953 Isolate* isolate, const interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator& iterator) {
2954 Handle<Object> object = iterator.GetConstantForIndexOperand(1, isolate);
2955 if (!IsString(*object)) {
2956 return kInvalid;
2957 }
2958 Handle<String> str = Handle<String>::cast(object);
2959 if (str->Equals(ReadOnlyRoots(isolate).then_string())) {
2960 return kThen;
2961 } else if (str->IsEqualTo(base::StaticCharVector("catch"))) {
2962 return kCatch;
2963 } else if (str->IsEqualTo(base::StaticCharVector("finally"))) {
2964 return kFinally;
2965 } else {
2966 return kInvalid;
2967 }
2968}
2969
2970bool TouchesRegister(const interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator& iterator,
2971 int index) {
2972 Bytecode bytecode = iterator.current_bytecode();
2973 int num_operands = Bytecodes::NumberOfOperands(bytecode);
2974 const interpreter::OperandType* operand_types =
2975 Bytecodes::GetOperandTypes(bytecode);
2976
2977 for (int i = 0; i < num_operands; ++i) {
2978 if (Bytecodes::IsRegisterOperandType(operand_types[i])) {
2979 int base_index = iterator.GetRegisterOperand(i).index();
2980 int num_registers;
2981 if (Bytecodes::IsRegisterListOperandType(operand_types[i])) {
2982 num_registers = iterator.GetRegisterCountOperand(++i);
2983 } else {
2984 num_registers =
2985 Bytecodes::GetNumberOfRegistersRepresentedBy(operand_types[i]);
2986 }
2987
2988 if (base_index <= index && index < base_index + num_registers) {
2989 return true;
2990 }
2991 }
2992 }
2993
2994 if (Bytecodes::WritesImplicitRegister(bytecode)) {
2995 return iterator.GetStarTargetRegister().index() == index;
2996 }
2997
2998 return false;
2999}
3000
3001bool CallsCatchMethod(Isolate* isolate, Handle<BytecodeArray> bytecode_array,
3002 int offset) {
3003 interpreter::BytecodeArrayIterator iterator(bytecode_array, offset);
3004
3005 while (!iterator.done()) {
3006 // We should be on a call instruction of some kind. While we could check
3007 // this, it may be difficult to create an exhaustive list of instructions
3008 // that could call, such as property getters, but at a minimum this
3009 // instruction should write to the accumulator.
3010 if (!Bytecodes::WritesAccumulator(iterator.current_bytecode())) {
3011 return false;
3012 }
3013
3014 iterator.Advance();
3015 // While usually the next instruction is a Star, sometimes we store and
3016 // reload from context first.
3017 if (iterator.done()) {
3018 return false;
3019 }
3020 if (iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kStaCurrentContextSlot) {
3021 // Step over patterns like:
3022 // StaCurrentContextSlot [x]
3023 // LdaImmutableCurrentContextSlot [x]
3024 unsigned int slot = iterator.GetIndexOperand(0);
3025 iterator.Advance();
3026 if (!iterator.done() &&
3027 (iterator.current_bytecode() ==
3028 Bytecode::kLdaImmutableCurrentContextSlot ||
3029 iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kLdaCurrentContextSlot)) {
3030 if (iterator.GetIndexOperand(0) != slot) {
3031 return false;
3032 }
3033 iterator.Advance();
3034 }
3035 } else if (iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kStaContextSlot) {
3036 // Step over patterns like:
3037 // StaContextSlot r_x [y] [z]
3038 // LdaContextSlot r_x [y] [z]
3039 int context = iterator.GetRegisterOperand(0).index();
3040 unsigned int slot = iterator.GetIndexOperand(1);
3041 unsigned int depth = iterator.GetUnsignedImmediateOperand(2);
3042 iterator.Advance();
3043 if (!iterator.done() &&
3044 (iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kLdaImmutableContextSlot ||
3045 iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kLdaContextSlot)) {
3046 if (iterator.GetRegisterOperand(0).index() != context ||
3047 iterator.GetIndexOperand(1) != slot ||
3048 iterator.GetUnsignedImmediateOperand(2) != depth) {
3049 return false;
3050 }
3051 iterator.Advance();
3052 }
3053 } else if (iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kStaLookupSlot) {
3054 // Step over patterns like:
3055 // StaLookupSlot [x] [_]
3056 // LdaLookupSlot [x]
3057 unsigned int slot = iterator.GetIndexOperand(0);
3058 iterator.Advance();
3059 if (!iterator.done() &&
3060 (iterator.current_bytecode() == Bytecode::kLdaLookupSlot ||
3061 iterator.current_bytecode() ==
3062 Bytecode::kLdaLookupSlotInsideTypeof)) {
3063 if (iterator.GetIndexOperand(0) != slot) {
3064 return false;
3065 }
3066 iterator.Advance();
3067 }
3068 }
3069
3070 // Next instruction should be a Star (store accumulator to register)
3071 if (iterator.done() || !Bytecodes::IsAnyStar(iterator.current_bytecode())) {
3072 return false;
3073 }
3074 // The register it stores to will be assumed to be our promise
3075 int promise_register = iterator.GetStarTargetRegister().index();
3076
3077 // TODO(crbug/40283993): Should we loop over non-matching instructions here
3078 // to allow code like
3079 // `const promise = foo(); console.log(...); promise.catch(...);`?
3080
3081 iterator.Advance();
3082 // We should be on a GetNamedProperty instruction.
3083 if (iterator.done() ||
3084 iterator.current_bytecode() != Bytecode::kGetNamedProperty ||
3085 iterator.GetRegisterOperand(0).index() != promise_register) {
3086 return false;
3087 }
3088 PromiseMethod method = GetPromiseMethod(isolate, iterator);
3089 if (method == kInvalid) {
3090 return false;
3091 }
3092
3093 iterator.Advance();
3094 // Next instruction should be a Star (save immediate to register)
3095 if (iterator.done() || !Bytecodes::IsAnyStar(iterator.current_bytecode())) {
3096 return false;
3097 }
3098 // This register contains the method we will eventually invoke
3099 int method_register = iterator.GetStarTargetRegister().index();
3100 if (method_register == promise_register) {
3101 return false;
3102 }
3103
3104 // Now we step over multiple instructions creating the arguments for the
3105 // method.
3106 while (true) {
3107 iterator.Advance();
3108 if (iterator.done()) {
3109 return false;
3110 }
3111 Bytecode bytecode = iterator.current_bytecode();
3112 if (bytecode == Bytecode::kCallProperty1 ||
3113 bytecode == Bytecode::kCallProperty2) {
3114 // This is a call property call of the right size, but is it a call of
3115 // the method and on the promise?
3116 if (iterator.GetRegisterOperand(0).index() == method_register &&
3117 iterator.GetRegisterOperand(1).index() == promise_register) {
3118 // This is our method call, but does it catch?
3119 if (method == kCatch ||
3120 (method == kThen && bytecode == Bytecode::kCallProperty2)) {
3121 return true;
3122 }
3123 // Break out of the inner loop, continuing the outer loop. We
3124 // will use the same procedure to check for chained method calls.
3125 break;
3126 }
3127 }
3128
3129 // Check for some instructions that should make us give up scanning.
3130 if (Bytecodes::IsJump(bytecode) || Bytecodes::IsSwitch(bytecode) ||
3131 Bytecodes::Returns(bytecode) ||
3132 Bytecodes::UnconditionallyThrows(bytecode)) {
3133 // Stop scanning at control flow instructions that aren't calls
3134 return false;
3135 }
3136
3137 if (TouchesRegister(iterator, promise_register) ||
3138 TouchesRegister(iterator, method_register)) {
3139 // Stop scanning at instruction that unexpectedly interacts with one of
3140 // the registers we care about.
3141 return false;
3142 }
3143 }
3144 }
3145 return false;
3146}
3147
3148bool CallsCatchMethod(const StackFrameSummaryIterator& iterator) {
3149 if (!iterator.frame()->is_java_script()) {
3150 return false;
3151 }
3152 if (iterator.frame_summary().IsJavaScript()) {
3153 auto& js_summary = iterator.frame_summary().AsJavaScript();
3154 if (IsBytecodeArray(*js_summary.abstract_code())) {
3155 if (CallsCatchMethod(
3156 iterator.isolate(),
3157 Handle<BytecodeArray>::cast(js_summary.abstract_code()),
3158 js_summary.code_offset())) {
3159 return true;
3160 }
3161 }
3162 }
3163 return false;
3164}
3165
3166} // namespace
3167
3168bool Isolate::WalkCallStackAndPromiseTree(
3169 MaybeHandle<JSPromise> rejected_promise,
3170 const std::function<void(PromiseHandler)>& callback) {
3171 bool is_promise_rejection = false;
3172
3173 Handle<JSPromise> promise;
3174 if (rejected_promise.ToHandle(&promise)) {
3175 is_promise_rejection = true;
3176 // If the promise has reactions, follow them and assume we are done. If
3177 // it has no reactions, assume promise is returned up the call stack and
3178 // trace accordingly. If the promise is not pending, it has no reactions
3179 // and is probably the result of a call to Promise.reject().
3180 if (promise->status() != Promise::kPending) {
3181 // Ignore this promise; set to null
3182 rejected_promise = MaybeHandle<JSPromise>();
3183 } else if (IsSmi(promise->reactions())) {
3184 // Also check that there is no outer promise
3185 Handle<Symbol> key = factory()->promise_handled_by_symbol();
3186 if (!IsJSPromise(*JSObject::GetDataProperty(this, promise, key))) {
3187 // Ignore this promise; set to null
3188 rejected_promise = MaybeHandle<JSPromise>();
3189 }
3190 }
3191 }
3192
3193 if (!is_promise_rejection && TopExceptionHandlerType(Tagged<Object>()) ==
3194 ExceptionHandlerType::kExternalTryCatch) {
3195 return true; // caught by external
3196 }
3197
3198 // Search for an exception handler by performing a full walk over the stack.
3199 for (StackFrameSummaryIterator iter(this); !iter.done(); iter.Advance()) {
3200 Isolate::CatchType prediction = PredictExceptionCatchAtFrame(iter);
3201
3202 bool caught;
3203 if (rejected_promise.is_null()) {
3204 switch (prediction) {
3205 case NOT_CAUGHT:
3206 // Uncaught unless this is a promise rejection and the code will call
3207 // .catch()
3208 caught = is_promise_rejection && CallsCatchMethod(iter);
3209 break;
3210 case CAUGHT_BY_ASYNC_AWAIT:
3211 // Uncaught unless this is a promise rejection and the code will call
3212 // .catch()
3213 caught = is_promise_rejection && CallsCatchMethod(iter);
3214 // Exceptions turn into promise rejections here
3215 is_promise_rejection = true;
3216 break;
3217 case CAUGHT_BY_PROMISE:
3218 // Exceptions turn into promise rejections here
3219 // TODO(leese): Perhaps we can handle the case where the reject method
3220 // is called in the promise constructor and it is still on the stack
3221 // by ignoring all try/catches on the stack until we get to the right
3222 // CAUGHT_BY_PROMISE?
3223 is_promise_rejection = true;
3224 caught = false;
3225 break;
3226 case CAUGHT_BY_EXTERNAL:
3227 caught = !is_promise_rejection;
3228 break;
3229 case CAUGHT_BY_JAVASCRIPT:
3230 caught = true;
3231 // Unless this is a promise rejection and the function is not async...
3232 DCHECK(iter.has_frame_summary());
3233 const FrameSummary& summary = iter.frame_summary();
3234 if (is_promise_rejection && summary.IsJavaScript()) {
3235 // If the catch happens in an async function, assume it will
3236 // await this promise. Alternately, if the code will call .catch,
3237 // assume it is on this promise.
3238 caught = IsAsyncFunction(iter.frame_summary()
3239 .AsJavaScript()
3240 .function()
3241 ->shared()
3242 ->kind()) ||
3243 CallsCatchMethod(iter);
3244 }
3245 break;
3246 }
3247 } else {
3248 // The frame that calls the reject handler will not catch that promise
3249 // regardless of what else it does. We will trace where this rejection
3250 // goes according to its reaction callbacks, but we first need to handle
3251 // the topmost debuggable frame just to ensure there is a debuggable
3252 // frame and to permit ignore listing there.
3253 caught = false;
3254 }
3255
3256 if (iter.frame()->is_java_script()) {
3257 bool debuggable = false;
3258 DCHECK(iter.has_frame_summary());
3259 const FrameSummary& summary = iter.frame_summary();
3260 if (summary.IsJavaScript()) {
3261 const auto& info = summary.AsJavaScript().function()->shared();
3262 if (info->IsSubjectToDebugging()) {
3263 callback({*info, false});
3264 debuggable = true;
3265 }
3266 }
3267
3268 // Ignore the rest of the call stack if this is a rejection and the
3269 // promise has handlers; we will trace where the rejection goes instead
3270 // of where it came from.
3271 if (debuggable && !rejected_promise.is_null()) {
3272 break;
3273 }
3274 }
3275
3276 if (caught) {
3277 return true;
3278 }
3279 }
3280
3281 if (rejected_promise.is_null()) {
3282 // Now follow promises if this is a promise reaction job.
3283 rejected_promise = TryGetCurrentTaskPromise(this);
3284 }
3285
3286 if (rejected_promise.ToHandle(&promise)) {
3287 return WalkPromiseTreeInternal(this, promise, callback);
3288 }
3289 // Nothing caught.
3290 return false;
3291}

3309void Isolate::InstallConditionalFeatures(Handle<NativeContext> context) {
3310 Handle<JSGlobalObject> global = handle(context->global_object(), this);
3311 // If some fuzzer decided to make the global object non-extensible, then
3312 // we can't install any features (and would CHECK-fail if we tried).
3313 if (!global->map()->is_extensible()) return;
3314 Handle<String> sab_name = factory()->SharedArrayBuffer_string();
3315 if (IsSharedArrayBufferConstructorEnabled(context)) {
3316 if (!JSObject::HasRealNamedProperty(this, global, sab_name)
3317 .FromMaybe(true)) {
3318 JSObject::AddProperty(this, global, factory()->SharedArrayBuffer_string(),
3319 shared_array_buffer_fun(), DONT_ENUM);
3320 }
3321 }
3322
3323 // Cache the "compile hints magic enabled" information so that it's available
3324 // during script streaming (when we don't have an entered NativeContext and
3325 // cannot query it). This will enable the feature for an Isolate if any
3326 // NativeContext enables it. But this overapproximation is fine, since the
3327 // site also has to enable the feature by inserting the magic comment - so an
3328 // experiment can guard against accidental enabling by not adding the magic
3329 // comment.
3330 if (!allow_compile_hints_magic_) {
3331 allow_compile_hints_magic_ = IsCompileHintsMagicEnabled(context);
3332 }
3333}

3336 Handle<NativeContext> context) {
3337 if (!v8_flags.enable_sharedarraybuffer_per_context) return true;
3338
3339 if (sharedarraybuffer_constructor_enabled_callback()) {
3340 v8::Local<v8::Context> api_context = v8::Utils::ToLocal(context);
3341 return sharedarraybuffer_constructor_enabled_callback()(api_context);
3342 }
3343 return false;
3344}

3348 compile_hints_magic_enabled_callback();

3350 v8::Local<v8::Context> api_context = v8::Utils::ToLocal(context);
3351 if (callback(api_context)) {
3352 return true;
3353 }
3354 }
3355 return false;

3421
3422Handle<NativeContext> Isolate::GetIncumbentContextSlow() {
3423 JavaScriptStackFrameIterator it(this);
3424
3425 // 1st candidate: most-recently-entered author function's context
3426 // if it's newer than the last Context::BackupIncumbentScope entry.
3427 //
3428 // NOTE: This code assumes that the stack grows downward.
3429 Address top_backup_incumbent =
3430 top_backup_incumbent_scope()
3431 ? top_backup_incumbent_scope()->JSStackComparableAddressPrivate()
3432 : 0;
3433 if (!it.done() &&
3434 (!top_backup_incumbent || it.frame()->sp() < top_backup_incumbent)) {
3435 Tagged<Context> context = Context::cast(it.frame()->context());
3436 // If the topmost_script_having_context is set then it must be correct.
3437 if (DEBUG_BOOL && !topmost_script_having_context().is_null()) {
3438 DCHECK_EQ(topmost_script_having_context()->native_context(),
3439 context->native_context());
3440 }
3441 return Handle<NativeContext>(context->native_context(), this);
3442 }
3443 DCHECK(topmost_script_having_context().is_null());
3444
3445 // 2nd candidate: the last Context::Scope's incumbent context if any.
3446 if (top_backup_incumbent_scope()) {
3447 v8::Local<v8::Context> incumbent_context =
3448 top_backup_incumbent_scope()->backup_incumbent_context_;
3449 return Utils::OpenHandle(*incumbent_context);
3450 }
3451
3452 // Last candidate: the entered context or microtask context.
3453 // Given that there is no other author function is running, there must be
3454 // no cross-context function running, then the incumbent realm must match
3455 // the entry realm.
3456 v8::Local<v8::Context> entered_context =
3457 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this)->GetEnteredOrMicrotaskContext();
3458 return Utils::OpenHandle(*entered_context);
3459}

3471 return from + sizeof(ThreadLocalTop);

3474void Isolate::ReleaseSharedPtrs() {
3475 base::MutexGuard lock(&managed_ptr_destructors_mutex_);
3476 while (managed_ptr_destructors_head_) {
3477 ManagedPtrDestructor* l = managed_ptr_destructors_head_;
3478 ManagedPtrDestructor* n = nullptr;
3479 managed_ptr_destructors_head_ = nullptr;
3480 for (; l != nullptr; l = n) {
3481 l->destructor_(l->shared_ptr_ptr_);
3482 n = l->next_;
3483 delete l;
3484 }
3485 }
3486}
3487
3488bool Isolate::IsBuiltinTableHandleLocation(Address* handle_location) {
3489 FullObjectSlot location(handle_location);
3490 FullObjectSlot first_root(builtin_table());
3491 FullObjectSlot last_root(first_root + Builtins::kBuiltinCount);
3492 if (location >= last_root) return false;
3493 if (location < first_root) return false;
3494 return true;
3495}
3496
3497void Isolate::RegisterManagedPtrDestructor(ManagedPtrDestructor* destructor) {
3498 base::MutexGuard lock(&managed_ptr_destructors_mutex_);
3499 DCHECK_NULL(destructor->prev_);
3500 DCHECK_NULL(destructor->next_);
3501 if (managed_ptr_destructors_head_) {
3502 managed_ptr_destructors_head_->prev_ = destructor;
3503 }
3504 destructor->next_ = managed_ptr_destructors_head_;
3505 managed_ptr_destructors_head_ = destructor;
3506}
3507
3508void Isolate::UnregisterManagedPtrDestructor(ManagedPtrDestructor* destructor) {
3509 base::MutexGuard lock(&managed_ptr_destructors_mutex_);
3510 if (destructor->prev_) {
3511 destructor->prev_->next_ = destructor->next_;
3512 } else {
3513 DCHECK_EQ(destructor, managed_ptr_destructors_head_);
3514 managed_ptr_destructors_head_ = destructor->next_;
3515 }
3516 if (destructor->next_) destructor->next_->prev_ = destructor->prev_;
3517 destructor->prev_ = nullptr;
3518 destructor->next_ = nullptr;
3519}

3521#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
3522bool Isolate::IsOnCentralStack(Address addr) {
3523#ifdef USE_SIMULATOR
3524 auto simulator_stack = Simulator::current(this)->GetCurrentStackView();
3525 uint8_t* addr_ptr = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(addr);
3526 return simulator_stack.begin() < addr_ptr &&
3527 addr_ptr <= simulator_stack.end();
3528#else
3529 uintptr_t upper_bound = base::Stack::GetStackStart();
3530 uintptr_t lower_bound = upper_bound - v8_flags.stack_size * KB -
3531 wasm::StackMemory::kJSLimitOffsetKB * KB;
3532 return lower_bound < addr && addr <= upper_bound;
3533#endif
3534}
3535
3536bool Isolate::IsOnCentralStack() {
3537#if USE_SIMULATOR
3538 return IsOnCentralStack(Simulator::current(this)->get_sp());
3539#else
3540 return IsOnCentralStack(GetCurrentStackPosition());
3541#endif
3542}

3544void Isolate::AddSharedWasmMemory(Handle<WasmMemoryObject> memory_object) {
3545 Handle<WeakArrayList> shared_wasm_memories =
3546 factory()->shared_wasm_memories();
3547 shared_wasm_memories = WeakArrayList::Append(
3548 this, shared_wasm_memories, MaybeObjectHandle::Weak(memory_object));
3549 heap()->set_shared_wasm_memories(*shared_wasm_memories);

3551
3552void Isolate::SyncStackLimit() {
3553 // Synchronize the stack limit with the active continuation for
3554 // stack-switching. This can be done before or after changing the stack
3555 // pointer itself, as long as we update both before the next stack check.
3556 // {StackGuard::SetStackLimitForStackSwitching} doesn't update the value of
3557 // the jslimit if it contains a sentinel value, and it is also thread-safe. So
3558 // if an interrupt is requested before, during or after this call, it will be
3559 // preserved and handled at the next stack check.
3560
3561 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
3562 auto continuation =
3563 WasmContinuationObject::cast(root(RootIndex::kActiveContinuation));
3564 wasm::StackMemory* stack =
3565 Managed<wasm::StackMemory>::cast(continuation->stack())->raw();
3566 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_stack_switching) {
3567 PrintF("Switch to stack #%d\n", stack->id());
3568 }
3569 uintptr_t limit = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(stack->jmpbuf()->stack_limit);
3570 stack_guard()->SetStackLimitForStackSwitching(limit);
3571 UpdateCentralStackInfo();
3572}
3573
3574void Isolate::UpdateCentralStackInfo() {
3575 Tagged<Object> current = root(RootIndex::kActiveContinuation);
3576 DCHECK(!IsUndefined(current));
3577 wasm::StackMemory* wasm_stack =
3578 Managed<wasm::StackMemory>::cast(
3579 WasmContinuationObject::cast(current)->stack())
3580 ->get()
3581 .get();
3582 current = WasmContinuationObject::cast(current)->parent();
3583 thread_local_top()->is_on_central_stack_flag_ =
3584 IsOnCentralStack(wasm_stack->jmpbuf()->sp);
3585 // Update the central stack info on switch. Only consider the innermost stack
3586 bool updated_central_stack = false;
3587 // We don't need to add all inactive stacks. Only the ones in the active chain
3588 // may contain cpp heap pointers.
3589 while (!IsUndefined(current)) {
3590 auto cont = WasmContinuationObject::cast(current);
3591 auto* wasm_stack =
3592 Managed<wasm::StackMemory>::cast(cont->stack())->get().get();
3593 // On x64 and arm64 we don't need to record the stack segments for
3594 // conservative stack scanning. We switch to the central stack for foreign
3595 // calls, so secondary stacks only contain wasm frames which use the precise
3596 // GC.
3597 current = cont->parent();
3598 if (!updated_central_stack && IsOnCentralStack(wasm_stack->jmpbuf()->sp)) {
3599 // This is the most recent use of the central stack in the call chain.
3600 // Switch to this SP if we need to switch to the central stack in the
3601 // future.
3602 thread_local_top()->central_stack_sp_ = wasm_stack->jmpbuf()->sp;
3603 thread_local_top()->central_stack_limit_ =
3604 reinterpret_cast<Address>(wasm_stack->jmpbuf()->stack_limit);
3605 updated_central_stack = true;
3606 }
3607 }
3608}
