5882namespace {
5883
5884MaybeHandle<JSPromise> NewRejectedPromise(Isolate* isolate,
5885 v8::Local<v8::Context> api_context,
5886 Handle<Object> exception) {
5887 v8::Local<v8::Promise::Resolver> resolver;
5888 API_ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(isolate, resolver,
5889 v8::Promise::Resolver::New(api_context),
5890 MaybeHandle<JSPromise>());
5891
5892 MAYBE_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(
5893 isolate, resolver->Reject(api_context, v8::Utils::ToLocal(exception)),
5894 MaybeHandle<JSPromise>());
5895
5896 v8::Local<v8::Promise> promise = resolver->GetPromise();
5897 return v8::Utils::OpenHandle(*promise);
5898}
5899
5900} // namespace
5901
5902MaybeHandle<JSPromise> Isolate::RunHostImportModuleDynamicallyCallback(
5903 MaybeHandle<Script> maybe_referrer, Handle<Object> specifier,
5904 MaybeHandle<Object> maybe_import_options_argument) {
5905 DCHECK(!is_execution_terminating());
5906 v8::Local<v8::Context> api_context = v8::Utils::ToLocal(native_context());
5907 if (host_import_module_dynamically_callback_ == nullptr) {
5908 Handle<Object> exception =
5909 factory()->NewError(error_function(), MessageTemplate::kUnsupported);
5910 return NewRejectedPromise(this, api_context, exception);
5911 }
5912
5913 Handle<String> specifier_str;
5914 MaybeHandle<String> maybe_specifier = Object::ToString(this, specifier);
5915 if (!maybe_specifier.ToHandle(&specifier_str)) {
5916 if (is_execution_terminating()) {
5917 return MaybeHandle<JSPromise>();
5918 }
5919 Handle<Object> exception(this->exception(), this);
5920 clear_exception();
5921 return NewRejectedPromise(this, api_context, exception);
5922 }
5923 DCHECK(!has_exception());
5924
5925 v8::Local<v8::Promise> promise;
5926 Handle<FixedArray> import_attributes_array;
5927 if (!GetImportAttributesFromArgument(maybe_import_options_argument)
5928 .ToHandle(&import_attributes_array)) {
5929 if (is_execution_terminating()) {
5930 return MaybeHandle<JSPromise>();
5931 }
5932 Handle<Object> exception(this->exception(), this);
5933 clear_exception();
5934 return NewRejectedPromise(this, api_context, exception);
5935 }
5936 Handle<FixedArray> host_defined_options;
5937 Handle<Object> resource_name;
5938 if (maybe_referrer.is_null()) {
5939 host_defined_options = factory()->empty_fixed_array();
5940 resource_name = factory()->null_value();
5941 } else {
5942 Handle<Script> referrer = maybe_referrer.ToHandleChecked();
5943 host_defined_options = handle(referrer->host_defined_options(), this);
5944 resource_name = handle(referrer->name(), this);
5945 }
5946
5947 API_ASSIGN_RETURN_ON_EXCEPTION_VALUE(
5948 this, promise,
5949 host_import_module_dynamically_callback_(
5950 api_context, v8::Utils::ToLocal(host_defined_options),
5951 v8::Utils::ToLocal(resource_name), v8::Utils::ToLocal(specifier_str),
5952 ToApiHandle<v8::FixedArray>(import_attributes_array)),
5953 MaybeHandle<JSPromise>());
5954 return v8::Utils::OpenHandle(*promise);
5955}
5956
5957MaybeHandle<FixedArray> Isolate::GetImportAttributesFromArgument(
5958 MaybeHandle<Object> maybe_import_options_argument) {
5959 Handle<FixedArray> import_attributes_array = factory()->empty_fixed_array();
5960 Handle<Object> import_options_argument;
5961 if (!maybe_import_options_argument.ToHandle(&import_options_argument) ||
5962 IsUndefined(*import_options_argument)) {
5963 return import_attributes_array;
5964 }
5965
5966 // The parser shouldn't have allowed the second argument to import() if
5967 // the flag wasn't enabled.
5968 DCHECK(v8_flags.harmony_import_assertions ||
5969 v8_flags.harmony_import_attributes);
5970
5971 if (!IsJSReceiver(*import_options_argument)) {
5972 this->Throw(
5973 *factory()->NewTypeError(MessageTemplate::kNonObjectImportArgument));
5974 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
5975 }
5976
5977 Handle<JSReceiver> import_options_argument_receiver =
5978 Handle<JSReceiver>::cast(import_options_argument);
5979
5980 Handle<Object> import_attributes_object;
5981
5982 if (v8_flags.harmony_import_attributes) {
5983 Handle<Name> with_key = factory()->with_string();
5984 if (!JSReceiver::GetProperty(this, import_options_argument_receiver,
5985 with_key)
5986 .ToHandle(&import_attributes_object)) {
5987 // This can happen if the property has a getter function that throws
5988 // an error.
5989 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
5990 }
5991 }
5992
5993 if (v8_flags.harmony_import_assertions &&
5994 (!v8_flags.harmony_import_attributes ||
5995 IsUndefined(*import_attributes_object))) {
5996 Handle<Name> assert_key = factory()->assert_string();
5997 if (!JSReceiver::GetProperty(this, import_options_argument_receiver,
5998 assert_key)
5999 .ToHandle(&import_attributes_object)) {
6000 // This can happen if the property has a getter function that throws
6001 // an error.
6002 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
6003 }
6004
6005 if (V8_UNLIKELY(!IsUndefined(*import_attributes_object))) {
6006 MessageLocation* location = nullptr;
6007 MessageLocation computed_location;
6008 if (ComputeLocation(&computed_location)) {
6009 location = &computed_location;
6010 }
6011 Handle<JSMessageObject> message = MessageHandler::MakeMessageObject(
6012 this, MessageTemplate::kImportAssertDeprecated, location,
6013 factory()->NewStringFromAsciiChecked("V8 v12.6 and Chrome 126"),
6014 Handle<FixedArray>::null());
6015 message->set_error_level(v8::Isolate::kMessageWarning);
6016 MessageHandler::ReportMessage(this, location, message);
6017 }
6018 }
6019
6020 // If there is no 'with' or 'assert' option in the options bag, it's not an
6021 // error. Just do the import() as if no assertions were provided.
6022 if (IsUndefined(*import_attributes_object)) return import_attributes_array;
6023
6024 if (!IsJSReceiver(*import_attributes_object)) {
6025 this->Throw(
6026 *factory()->NewTypeError(MessageTemplate::kNonObjectAssertOption));
6027 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
6028 }
6029
6030 Handle<JSReceiver> import_attributes_object_receiver =
6031 Handle<JSReceiver>::cast(import_attributes_object);
6032
6033 Handle<FixedArray> assertion_keys;
6034 if (!KeyAccumulator::GetKeys(this, import_attributes_object_receiver,
6035 KeyCollectionMode::kOwnOnly, ENUMERABLE_STRINGS,
6036 GetKeysConversion::kConvertToString)
6037 .ToHandle(&assertion_keys)) {
6038 // This happens if the assertions object is a Proxy whose ownKeys() or
6039 // getOwnPropertyDescriptor() trap throws.
6040 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
6041 }
6042
6043 bool has_non_string_attribute = false;
6044
6045 // The assertions will be passed to the host in the form: [key1,
6046 // value1, key2, value2, ...].
6047 constexpr size_t kAttributeEntrySizeForDynamicImport = 2;
6048 import_attributes_array = factory()->NewFixedArray(static_cast<int>(
6049 assertion_keys->length() * kAttributeEntrySizeForDynamicImport));
6050 for (int i = 0; i < assertion_keys->length(); i++) {
6051 Handle<String> assertion_key(String::cast(assertion_keys->get(i)), this);
6052 Handle<Object> assertion_value;
6053 if (!Object::GetPropertyOrElement(this, import_attributes_object_receiver,
6054 assertion_key)
6055 .ToHandle(&assertion_value)) {
6056 // This can happen if the property has a getter function that throws
6057 // an error.
6058 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
6059 }
6060
6061 if (!IsString(*assertion_value)) {
6062 has_non_string_attribute = true;
6063 }
6064
6065 import_attributes_array->set((i * kAttributeEntrySizeForDynamicImport),
6066 *assertion_key);
6067 import_attributes_array->set((i * kAttributeEntrySizeForDynamicImport) + 1,
6068 *assertion_value);
6069 }
6070
6071 if (has_non_string_attribute) {
6072 this->Throw(*factory()->NewTypeError(
6073 MessageTemplate::kNonStringImportAssertionValue));
6074 return MaybeHandle<FixedArray>();
6075 }
6076
6077 return import_attributes_array;
6078}
6079
6080void Isolate::ClearKeptObjects() { heap()->ClearKeptObjects(); }

6087MaybeHandle<JSObject> Isolate::RunHostInitializeImportMetaObjectCallback(
6088 Handle<SourceTextModule> module) {

6090 Handle<JSObject> import_meta = factory()->NewJSObjectWithNullProto();

6093 host_initialize_import_meta_object_callback_(
6094 api_context, Utils::ToLocal(Handle<Module>::cast(module)),
6095 v8::Local<v8::Object>::Cast(v8::Utils::ToLocal(import_meta)));

6097 }

6111MaybeHandle<NativeContext> Isolate::RunHostCreateShadowRealmContextCallback() {
6112 if (host_create_shadow_realm_context_callback_ == nullptr) {
6113 Handle<Object> exception =

6115 Throw(*exception);

6122 this, shadow_realm_context,
6123 host_create_shadow_realm_context_callback_(api_context),
6124 MaybeHandle<NativeContext>());

6128 shadow_realm_context_handle->set_scope_info(
6129 ReadOnlyRoots(this).shadow_realm_scope_info());

6131}

6249void Isolate::RunAllPromiseHooks(PromiseHookType type,
6250 Handle<JSPromise> promise,
6251 Handle<Object> parent) {
6252#ifdef V8_ENABLE_JAVASCRIPT_PROMISE_HOOKS
6253 if (HasContextPromiseHooks()) {
6254 native_context()->RunPromiseHook(type, promise, parent);
6255 }
6256#endif
6257 if (HasIsolatePromiseHooks() || HasAsyncEventDelegate()) {
6258 RunPromiseHook(type, promise, parent);
6259 }
6260}
6261
6262void Isolate::RunPromiseHook(PromiseHookType type, Handle<JSPromise> promise,
6263 Handle<Object> parent) {
6264 if (!HasIsolatePromiseHooks()) return;
6265 DCHECK(promise_hook_ != nullptr);
6266 promise_hook_(type, v8::Utils::PromiseToLocal(promise),
6267 v8::Utils::ToLocal(parent));
6268}
6269
6270void Isolate::OnAsyncFunctionSuspended(Handle<JSPromise> promise,
6271 Handle<JSPromise> parent) {
6272 DCHECK_EQ(0, promise->async_task_id());
6273 RunAllPromiseHooks(PromiseHookType::kInit, promise, parent);
6274 if (HasAsyncEventDelegate()) {
6275 DCHECK_NE(nullptr, async_event_delegate_);
6276 promise->set_async_task_id(++async_task_count_);
6277 async_event_delegate_->AsyncEventOccurred(debug::kDebugAwait,
6278 promise->async_task_id(), false);
6279 }
6280}
6281
6282void Isolate::OnPromiseThen(Handle<JSPromise> promise) {
6283 if (!HasAsyncEventDelegate()) return;
6284 Maybe<debug::DebugAsyncActionType> action_type =
6285 Nothing<debug::DebugAsyncActionType>();
6286 for (JavaScriptStackFrameIterator it(this); !it.done(); it.Advance()) {
6287 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> infos;
6288 it.frame()->GetFunctions(&infos);
6289 for (auto it = infos.rbegin(); it != infos.rend(); ++it) {
6290 Handle<SharedFunctionInfo> info = *it;
6291 if (info->HasBuiltinId()) {
6292 // We should not report PromiseThen and PromiseCatch which is called
6293 // indirectly, e.g. Promise.all calls Promise.then internally.
6294 switch (info->builtin_id()) {
6295 case Builtin::kPromisePrototypeCatch:
6296 action_type = Just(debug::kDebugPromiseCatch);
6297 continue;
6298 case Builtin::kPromisePrototypeFinally:
6299 action_type = Just(debug::kDebugPromiseFinally);
6300 continue;
6301 case Builtin::kPromisePrototypeThen:
6302 action_type = Just(debug::kDebugPromiseThen);
6303 continue;
6304 default:
6305 return;
6306 }
6307 }
6308 if (info->IsUserJavaScript() && action_type.IsJust()) {
6309 DCHECK_EQ(0, promise->async_task_id());
6310 promise->set_async_task_id(++async_task_count_);
6311 async_event_delegate_->AsyncEventOccurred(action_type.FromJust(),
6312 promise->async_task_id(),
6313 debug()->IsBlackboxed(info));
6314 }
6315 return;
6316 }
6317 }
6318}
6319
6320void Isolate::OnPromiseBefore(Handle<JSPromise> promise) {
6321 RunPromiseHook(PromiseHookType::kBefore, promise,
6322 factory()->undefined_value());
6323 if (HasAsyncEventDelegate()) {
6324 if (promise->async_task_id()) {
6325 async_event_delegate_->AsyncEventOccurred(
6326 debug::kDebugWillHandle, promise->async_task_id(), false);
6327 }
6328 }
6329}
6330
6331void Isolate::OnPromiseAfter(Handle<JSPromise> promise) {
6332 RunPromiseHook(PromiseHookType::kAfter, promise,
6333 factory()->undefined_value());
6334 if (HasAsyncEventDelegate()) {
6335 if (promise->async_task_id()) {
6336 async_event_delegate_->AsyncEventOccurred(
6337 debug::kDebugDidHandle, promise->async_task_id(), false);
6338 }
6339 }
6340}
6341
6342void Isolate::OnTerminationDuringRunMicrotasks() {
6343 DCHECK(is_execution_terminating());
6344 // This performs cleanup for when RunMicrotasks (in
6345 // builtins-microtask-queue-gen.cc) is aborted via a termination exception.
6346 // This has to be kept in sync with the code in said file. Currently this
6347 // includes:
6348 //
6349 // (1) Resetting the |current_microtask| slot on the Isolate to avoid leaking
6350 // memory (and also to keep |current_microtask| not being undefined as an
6351 // indicator that we're currently pumping the microtask queue).
6352 // (2) Empty the promise stack to avoid leaking memory.
6353 // (3) If the |current_microtask| is a promise reaction or resolve thenable
6354 // job task, then signal the async event delegate and debugger that the
6355 // microtask finished running.
6356 //
6357
6358 // Reset the |current_microtask| global slot.
6359 Handle<Microtask> current_microtask(
6360 Microtask::cast(heap()->current_microtask()), this);
6361 heap()->set_current_microtask(ReadOnlyRoots(this).undefined_value());
6362
6363 if (IsPromiseReactionJobTask(*current_microtask)) {
6364 Handle<PromiseReactionJobTask> promise_reaction_job_task =
6365 Handle<PromiseReactionJobTask>::cast(current_microtask);
6366 Handle<HeapObject> promise_or_capability(
6367 promise_reaction_job_task->promise_or_capability(), this);
6368 if (IsPromiseCapability(*promise_or_capability)) {
6369 promise_or_capability = handle(
6370 Handle<PromiseCapability>::cast(promise_or_capability)->promise(),
6371 this);
6372 }
6373 if (IsJSPromise(*promise_or_capability)) {
6374 OnPromiseAfter(Handle<JSPromise>::cast(promise_or_capability));
6375 }
6376 } else if (IsPromiseResolveThenableJobTask(*current_microtask)) {
6377 Handle<PromiseResolveThenableJobTask> promise_resolve_thenable_job_task =
6378 Handle<PromiseResolveThenableJobTask>::cast(current_microtask);
6379 Handle<JSPromise> promise_to_resolve(
6380 promise_resolve_thenable_job_task->promise_to_resolve(), this);
6381 OnPromiseAfter(promise_to_resolve);
6382 }
6383
6384 SetTerminationOnExternalTryCatch();
6385}

6403
6404void Isolate::CountUsage(v8::Isolate::UseCounterFeature feature) {
6405 CountUsage(base::VectorOf({feature}));
6406}
6407
6408void Isolate::CountUsage(
6409 base::Vector<const v8::Isolate::UseCounterFeature> features) {
6410 // The counter callback
6411 // - may cause the embedder to call into V8, which is not generally possible
6412 // during GC.
6413 // - requires a current native context, which may not always exist.
6414 // TODO(jgruber): Consider either removing the native context requirement in
6415 // blink, or passing it to the callback explicitly.
6416 if (heap_.gc_state() == Heap::NOT_IN_GC && !context().is_null()) {
6417 DCHECK(IsContext(context()));
6418 DCHECK(IsNativeContext(context()->native_context()));
6419 if (use_counter_callback_) {
6420 HandleScope handle_scope(this);
6421 for (auto feature : features) {
6422 use_counter_callback_(reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this), feature);
6423 }
6424 }
6425 } else {
6426 heap_.IncrementDeferredCounts(features);
6427 }
6428}

6433std::string Isolate::GetTurboCfgFileName(Isolate* isolate) {
6434 if (const char* filename = v8_flags.trace_turbo_cfg_file) return filename;
6435 std::ostringstream os;
6436 os << "turbo-" << base::OS::GetCurrentProcessId() << "-";
6437 if (isolate != nullptr) {
6438 os << isolate->id();
6439 } else {
6440 os << "any";
6441 }
6442 os << ".cfg";
6443 return os.str();
6444}
6445
6446// Heap::detached_contexts tracks detached contexts as pairs
6447// (the context, number of GC since the context was detached).
6448void Isolate::AddDetachedContext(Handle<Context> context) {
6449 HandleScope scope(this);
6450 Handle<WeakArrayList> detached_contexts = factory()->detached_contexts();
6451 detached_contexts = WeakArrayList::AddToEnd(
6452 this, detached_contexts, MaybeObjectHandle::Weak(context), Smi::zero());
6453 heap()->set_detached_contexts(*detached_contexts);
6454}
6455
6456void Isolate::CheckDetachedContextsAfterGC() {
6457 HandleScope scope(this);
6458 Handle<WeakArrayList> detached_contexts = factory()->detached_contexts();
6459 int length = detached_contexts->length();
6460 if (length == 0) return;
6461 int new_length = 0;
6462 for (int i = 0; i < length; i += 2) {
6463 Tagged<MaybeObject> context = detached_contexts->Get(i);
6464 DCHECK(context.IsWeakOrCleared());
6465 if (!context.IsCleared()) {
6466 int mark_sweeps = detached_contexts->Get(i + 1).ToSmi().value();
6467 detached_contexts->Set(new_length, context);
6468 detached_contexts->Set(new_length + 1, Smi::FromInt(mark_sweeps + 1));
6469 new_length += 2;
6470 }
6471 }
6472 detached_contexts->set_length(new_length);
6473 while (new_length < length) {
6474 detached_contexts->Set(new_length, Smi::zero());
6475 ++new_length;
6476 }
6477
6478 if (v8_flags.trace_detached_contexts) {
6479 PrintF("%d detached contexts are collected out of %d\n",
6480 length - new_length, length);
6481 for (int i = 0; i < new_length; i += 2) {
6482 Tagged<MaybeObject> context = detached_contexts->Get(i);
6483 int mark_sweeps = detached_contexts->Get(i + 1).ToSmi().value();
6484 DCHECK(context.IsWeakOrCleared());
6485 if (mark_sweeps > 3) {
6486 PrintF("detached context %p\n survived %d GCs (leak?)\n",
6487 reinterpret_cast<void*>(context.ptr()), mark_sweeps);
6488 }
6489 }
6490 }
6491}
6492
6493void Isolate::DetachGlobal(Handle<Context> env) {
6494 counters()->errors_thrown_per_context()->AddSample(
6495 env->native_context()->GetErrorsThrown());
6496
6497 ReadOnlyRoots roots(this);
6498 Handle<JSGlobalProxy> global_proxy(env->global_proxy(), this);
6499 // NOTE: Turbofan's JSNativeContextSpecialization and Maglev depend on
6500 // DetachGlobal causing a map change.
6501 JSObject::ForceSetPrototype(this, global_proxy, factory()->null_value());
6502 // Detach the global object from the native context by making its map
6503 // contextless (use the global metamap instead of the contextful one).
6504 global_proxy->map()->set_map(roots.meta_map());
6505 global_proxy->map()->set_constructor_or_back_pointer(roots.null_value(),
6506 kRelaxedStore);
6507 if (v8_flags.track_detached_contexts) AddDetachedContext(env);
6508 DCHECK(global_proxy->IsDetached());
6509
6510 env->native_context()->set_microtask_queue(this, nullptr);
6511}

6513double Isolate::LoadStartTimeMs() {
6514 base::MutexGuard guard(&rail_mutex_);
6515 return load_start_time_ms_;
6516}
6517
6518void Isolate::UpdateLoadStartTime() {
6519 base::MutexGuard guard(&rail_mutex_);
6520 load_start_time_ms_ = heap()->MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
6521}
6522
6523void Isolate::SetRAILMode(RAILMode rail_mode) {
6524 RAILMode old_rail_mode = rail_mode_.load();
6525 if (old_rail_mode != PERFORMANCE_LOAD && rail_mode == PERFORMANCE_LOAD) {
6526 base::MutexGuard guard(&rail_mutex_);
6527 load_start_time_ms_ = heap()->MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeInMs();
6528 }
6529 rail_mode_.store(rail_mode);
6530 if (old_rail_mode == PERFORMANCE_LOAD && rail_mode != PERFORMANCE_LOAD) {
6531 if (auto* job = heap()->incremental_marking()->incremental_marking_job()) {
6532 // The task will start incremental marking (if needed not already started)
6533 // and advance marking if incremental marking is active.
6534 job->ScheduleTask();
6535 }
6536 }
6537 if (v8_flags.trace_rail) {
6538 PrintIsolate(this, "RAIL mode: %s\n", RAILModeName(rail_mode));
6539 }
6540}

6549void Isolate::PrintWithTimestamp(const char* format, ...) {
6550 base::OS::Print("[%d:%p] %8.0f ms: ", base::OS::GetCurrentProcessId(),
6551 static_cast<void*>(this), time_millis_since_init());
6552 va_list arguments;
6553 va_start(arguments, format);
6554 base::OS::VPrint(format, arguments);
6555 va_end(arguments);
6556}
6557
6558void Isolate::SetIdle(bool is_idle) {
6559 StateTag state = current_vm_state();
6560 if (js_entry_sp() != kNullAddress) return;
6561 DCHECK(state == EXTERNAL || state == IDLE);
6562 if (is_idle) {
6563 set_current_vm_state(IDLE);
6564 } else if (state == IDLE) {
6565 set_current_vm_state(EXTERNAL);
6566 }
6567}
6568
6569void Isolate::CollectSourcePositionsForAllBytecodeArrays() {
6570 if (!initialized_) return;
6571
6572 HandleScope scope(this);
6573 std::vector<Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>> sfis;
6574 {
6575 HeapObjectIterator iterator(heap());
6576 for (Tagged<HeapObject> obj = iterator.Next(); !obj.is_null();
6577 obj = iterator.Next()) {
6578 if (!IsSharedFunctionInfo(obj)) continue;
6579 Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo> sfi = SharedFunctionInfo::cast(obj);
6580 // If the script is a Smi, then the SharedFunctionInfo is in
6581 // the process of being deserialized.
6582 Tagged<Object> script = sfi->raw_script(kAcquireLoad);
6583 if (IsSmi(script)) {
6584 DCHECK_EQ(script, Smi::uninitialized_deserialization_value());
6585 continue;
6586 }
6587 if (!sfi->CanCollectSourcePosition(this)) continue;
6588 sfis.push_back(Handle<SharedFunctionInfo>(sfi, this));
6589 }
6590 }
6591 for (auto sfi : sfis) {
6592 SharedFunctionInfo::EnsureSourcePositionsAvailable(this, sfi);
6593 }
6594}

6600std::string GetStringFromLocales(Isolate* isolate, Handle<Object> locales) {
6601 if (IsUndefined(*locales, isolate)) return "";
6602 return std::string(String::cast(*locales)->ToCString().get());
6603}
6604
6605bool StringEqualsLocales(Isolate* isolate, const std::string& str,
6606 Handle<Object> locales) {
6607 if (IsUndefined(*locales, isolate)) return str.empty();
6608 return Handle<String>::cast(locales)->IsEqualTo(
6609 base::VectorOf(str.c_str(), str.length()));
6610}

6613
6614const std::string& Isolate::DefaultLocale() {
6615 if (default_locale_.empty()) {
6616 icu::Locale default_locale;
6617 // Translate ICU's fallback locale to a well-known locale.
6618 if (strcmp(default_locale.getName(), "en_US_POSIX") == 0 ||
6619 strcmp(default_locale.getName(), "c") == 0) {
6620 set_default_locale("en-US");
6621 } else {
6622 // Set the locale
6623 set_default_locale(default_locale.isBogus()
6624 ? "und"
6625 : Intl::ToLanguageTag(default_locale).FromJust());
6626 }
6627 DCHECK(!default_locale_.empty());
6628 }
6629 return default_locale_;
6630}
6631
6632void Isolate::ResetDefaultLocale() {
6633 default_locale_.clear();
6634 clear_cached_icu_objects();
6635 // We inline fast paths assuming certain locales. Since this path is rarely
6636 // taken, we deoptimize everything to keep things simple.
6637 Deoptimizer::DeoptimizeAll(this);
6638}
6639
6640icu::UMemory* Isolate::get_cached_icu_object(ICUObjectCacheType cache_type,
6641 Handle<Object> locales) {
6642 const ICUObjectCacheEntry& entry =
6643 icu_object_cache_[static_cast<int>(cache_type)];
6644 return StringEqualsLocales(this, entry.locales, locales) ? entry.obj.get()
6645 : nullptr;
6646}

6666
6667bool StackLimitCheck::HandleStackOverflowAndTerminationRequest() {
6668 DCHECK(InterruptRequested());
6669 if (V8_UNLIKELY(HasOverflowed())) {
6670 isolate_->StackOverflow();
6671 return true;
6672 }
6673 if (V8_UNLIKELY(isolate_->stack_guard()->HasTerminationRequest())) {
6674 isolate_->TerminateExecution();
6675 return true;
6676 }
6677 return false;
6678}
6679
6680bool StackLimitCheck::JsHasOverflowed(uintptr_t gap) const {
6681 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate_->stack_guard();
6682#ifdef USE_SIMULATOR
6683 // The simulator uses a separate JS stack.
6684 Address jssp_address = Simulator::current(isolate_)->get_sp();
6685 uintptr_t jssp = static_cast<uintptr_t>(jssp_address);
6686 if (jssp - gap < stack_guard->real_jslimit()) return true;
6687#endif // USE_SIMULATOR
6688 return GetCurrentStackPosition() - gap < stack_guard->real_climit();
6689}
6690
6691bool StackLimitCheck::WasmHasOverflowed(uintptr_t gap) const {
6692 StackGuard* stack_guard = isolate_->stack_guard();
6693 auto sp = isolate_->thread_local_top()->secondary_stack_sp_;
6694 auto limit = isolate_->thread_local_top()->secondary_stack_limit_;
6695 if (sp == 0) {
6696#ifdef USE_SIMULATOR
6697 // The simulator uses a separate JS stack.
6698 // Use it if code is executed on the central stack.
6699 Address jssp_address = Simulator::current(isolate_)->get_sp();
6700 uintptr_t jssp = static_cast<uintptr_t>(jssp_address);
6701 if (jssp - gap < stack_guard->real_jslimit()) return true;
6702#endif // USE_SIMULATOR
6703 sp = GetCurrentStackPosition();
6704 limit = stack_guard->real_climit();
6705 }
6706 return sp - gap < limit;
6707}

6740namespace {
6741
6742bool Overlapping(const MemoryRange& a, const MemoryRange& b) {
6743 uintptr_t a1 = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(a.start);
6744 uintptr_t a2 = a1 + a.length_in_bytes;
6745 uintptr_t b1 = reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t>(b.start);
6746 uintptr_t b2 = b1 + b.length_in_bytes;
6747 // Either b1 or b2 are in the [a1, a2) range.
6748 return (a1 <= b1 && b1 < a2) || (a1 <= b2 && b2 < a2);
6749}
6750
6751} // anonymous namespace
6752
6753#endif // DEBUG
6754
6755void Isolate::AddCodeMemoryRange(MemoryRange range) {
6756 base::MutexGuard guard(&code_pages_mutex_);
6757 std::vector<MemoryRange>* old_code_pages = GetCodePages();
6758 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(old_code_pages);
6759#ifdef DEBUG
6760 auto overlapping = [range](const MemoryRange& a) {
6761 return Overlapping(range, a);
6762 };
6763 DCHECK_EQ(old_code_pages->end(),
6764 std::find_if(old_code_pages->begin(), old_code_pages->end(),
6765 overlapping));
6766#endif
6767
6768 std::vector<MemoryRange>* new_code_pages;
6769 if (old_code_pages == &code_pages_buffer1_) {
6770 new_code_pages = &code_pages_buffer2_;
6771 } else {
6772 new_code_pages = &code_pages_buffer1_;
6773 }
6774
6775 // Copy all existing data from the old vector to the new vector and insert the
6776 // new page.
6777 new_code_pages->clear();
6778 new_code_pages->reserve(old_code_pages->size() + 1);
6779 std::merge(old_code_pages->begin(), old_code_pages->end(), &range, &range + 1,
6780 std::back_inserter(*new_code_pages),
6781 [](const MemoryRange& a, const MemoryRange& b) {
6782 return a.start < b.start;
6783 });
6784
6785 // Atomically switch out the pointer
6786 SetCodePages(new_code_pages);
6787}
6788
6789// |chunk| is either a Page or an executable LargePage.
6790void Isolate::AddCodeMemoryChunk(MutablePageMetadata* chunk) {
6791 // We only keep track of individual code pages/allocations if we are on arm32,
6792 // because on x64 and arm64 we have a code range which makes this unnecessary.
6793#if defined(V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM)
6794 void* new_page_start = reinterpret_cast<void*>(chunk->area_start());
6795 size_t new_page_size = chunk->area_size();
6796
6797 MemoryRange new_range{new_page_start, new_page_size};
6798
6799 AddCodeMemoryRange(new_range);
6800#endif // !defined(V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM)
6801}
6802
6803void Isolate::AddCodeRange(Address begin, size_t length_in_bytes) {
6804 AddCodeMemoryRange(
6805 MemoryRange{reinterpret_cast<void*>(begin), length_in_bytes});
6806}

6811
6812v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId Isolate::GetOrRegisterRecorderContextId(
6813 Handle<NativeContext> context) {
6814 if (serializer_enabled_) return v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId::Empty();
6815 i::Tagged<i::Object> id = context->recorder_context_id();
6816 if (IsNullOrUndefined(id)) {
6817 CHECK_LT(last_recorder_context_id_, i::Smi::kMaxValue);
6818 context->set_recorder_context_id(
6819 i::Smi::FromIntptr(++last_recorder_context_id_));
6820 v8::HandleScope handle_scope(reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this));
6821 auto result = recorder_context_id_map_.emplace(
6822 std::piecewise_construct,
6823 std::forward_as_tuple(last_recorder_context_id_),
6824 std::forward_as_tuple(reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this),
6825 ToApiHandle<v8::Context>(context)));
6826 result.first->second.SetWeak(
6827 reinterpret_cast<void*>(last_recorder_context_id_),
6828 RemoveContextIdCallback, v8::WeakCallbackType::kParameter);
6829 return v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId(last_recorder_context_id_);
6830 } else {
6831 DCHECK(IsSmi(id));
6832 return v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId(
6833 static_cast<uintptr_t>(i::Smi::ToInt(id)));
6834 }
6835}
6836
6837MaybeLocal<v8::Context> Isolate::GetContextFromRecorderContextId(
6838 v8::metrics::Recorder::ContextId id) {
6839 auto result = recorder_context_id_map_.find(id.id_);
6840 if (result == recorder_context_id_map_.end() || result->second.IsEmpty())
6841 return MaybeLocal<v8::Context>();
6842 return result->second.Get(reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(this));
6843}

6873
6874// |chunk| is either a Page or an executable LargePage.
6875void Isolate::RemoveCodeMemoryChunk(MutablePageMetadata* chunk) {
6876 // We only keep track of individual code pages/allocations if we are on arm32,
6877 // because on x64 and arm64 we have a code range which makes this unnecessary.
6878#if defined(V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM)
6879 void* removed_page_start = reinterpret_cast<void*>(chunk->area_start());
6880 std::vector<MemoryRange>* old_code_pages = GetCodePages();
6881 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(old_code_pages);
6882
6883 std::vector<MemoryRange>* new_code_pages;
6884 if (old_code_pages == &code_pages_buffer1_) {
6885 new_code_pages = &code_pages_buffer2_;
6886 } else {
6887 new_code_pages = &code_pages_buffer1_;
6888 }
6889
6890 // Copy all existing data from the old vector to the new vector except the
6891 // removed page.
6892 new_code_pages->clear();
6893 new_code_pages->reserve(old_code_pages->size() - 1);
6894 std::remove_copy_if(old_code_pages->begin(), old_code_pages->end(),
6895 std::back_inserter(*new_code_pages),
6896 [removed_page_start](const MemoryRange& range) {
6897 return range.start == removed_page_start;
6898 });
6899 DCHECK_EQ(old_code_pages->size(), new_code_pages->size() + 1);
6900 // Atomically switch out the pointer
6901 SetCodePages(new_code_pages);
6902#endif // !defined(V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM)
6903}

6907// static
6908Address Isolate::load_from_stack_count_address(const char* function_name) {
6909 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(function_name);
6910 if (!stack_access_count_map) {
6911 stack_access_count_map = new MapOfLoadsAndStoresPerFunction{};
6912 }
6913 auto& map = *stack_access_count_map;
6914 std::string name(function_name);
6915 // It is safe to return the address of std::map values.
6916 // Only iterators and references to the erased elements are invalidated.
6917 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&map[name].first);
6918}
6919
6920// static
6921Address Isolate::store_to_stack_count_address(const char* function_name) {
6922 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(function_name);
6923 if (!stack_access_count_map) {
6924 stack_access_count_map = new MapOfLoadsAndStoresPerFunction{};
6925 }
6926 auto& map = *stack_access_count_map;
6927 std::string name(function_name);
6928 // It is safe to return the address of std::map values.
6929 // Only iterators and references to the erased elements are invalidated.
6930 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&map[name].second);
6931}
6932
6933void Isolate::LocalsBlockListCacheSet(Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info,
6934 Handle<ScopeInfo> outer_scope_info,
6935 Handle<StringSet> locals_blocklist) {
6936 Handle<EphemeronHashTable> cache;
6937 if (IsEphemeronHashTable(heap()->locals_block_list_cache())) {
6938 cache = handle(EphemeronHashTable::cast(heap()->locals_block_list_cache()),
6939 this);
6940 } else {
6941 CHECK(IsUndefined(heap()->locals_block_list_cache()));
6942 constexpr int kInitialCapacity = 8;
6943 cache = EphemeronHashTable::New(this, kInitialCapacity);
6944 }
6945 DCHECK(IsEphemeronHashTable(*cache));
6946
6947 Handle<Object> value;
6948 if (!outer_scope_info.is_null()) {
6949 value = factory()->NewTuple2(outer_scope_info, locals_blocklist,
6950 AllocationType::kYoung);
6951 } else {
6952 value = locals_blocklist;
6953 }
6954
6955 CHECK(!value.is_null());
6956 cache = EphemeronHashTable::Put(cache, scope_info, value);
6957 heap()->set_locals_block_list_cache(*cache);
6958}
6959
6960Tagged<Object> Isolate::LocalsBlockListCacheGet(Handle<ScopeInfo> scope_info) {
6961 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
6962
6963 if (!IsEphemeronHashTable(heap()->locals_block_list_cache())) {
6964 return ReadOnlyRoots(this).the_hole_value();
6965 }
6966
6967 Tagged<Object> maybe_value =
6968 EphemeronHashTable::cast(heap()->locals_block_list_cache())
6969 ->Lookup(scope_info);
6970 if (IsTuple2(maybe_value)) return Tuple2::cast(maybe_value)->value2();
6971
6972 CHECK(IsStringSet(maybe_value) || IsTheHole(maybe_value));
6973 return maybe_value;
6974}

6980
6981void DefaultWasmAsyncResolvePromiseCallback(
6982 v8::Isolate* isolate, v8::Local<v8::Context> context,
6983 v8::Local<v8::Promise::Resolver> resolver, v8::Local<v8::Value> result,
6984 WasmAsyncSuccess success) {
6985 MicrotasksScope microtasks_scope(context,
6986 MicrotasksScope::kDoNotRunMicrotasks);
6987
6988 Maybe<bool> ret = success == WasmAsyncSuccess::kSuccess
6989 ? resolver->Resolve(context, result)
6990 : resolver->Reject(context, result);
6991 // It's guaranteed that no exceptions will be thrown by these
6992 // operations, but execution might be terminating.
6993 CHECK(ret.IsJust() ? ret.FromJust() : isolate->IsExecutionTerminating());
6994}
